body:

Known as [b]Rhythm Heaven Groove[/b] or [b]Rhythm Paradise Groove[/b] in English.

title: rhythm_tengoku
body:
A series of rhythm games starting with the eponymous [i][[Rhythm Tengoku (game)|]][/i] (lit. "Rhythm Heaven") for [[Game Boy Advance]]. The original game was never sold outside of its home country, allowing its sequels to be confusingly named.

Its sequels are:

* [[Rhythm Tengoku Gold]], aka "Rhythm Heaven" (US) or "Rhythm Paradise" (Europe), for the [[Nintendo DS|DS]].
* [[Minna no Rhythm Tengoku]], aka "Rhythm Heaven Fever" (US) or "Beat the Beat: Rhythm Paradise" (Europe), for the [[Wii]].
* [[Rhythm Tengoku The Best+]], aka "Rhythm Heaven Megamix" (US) or "Rhythm Paradise Megamix" (Europe), for the [[Nintendo 3DS|3DS]].
* [[Rhythm Tengoku Miracle Stars]], aka "Rhythm Heaven Groove" (US) or "Rhythm Paradise Groove" (Europe), for the [[Nintendo Switch|Switch]].

h4.  External links

* "Wikipedia: Rhythm Tengoku":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rhythm_Tengoku
* "Wikipedia: Rhythm Heaven":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rhythm_Heaven
* "Wikipedia: Rhythm Heaven Fever":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rhythm_Heaven_Fever
* "Wikipedia: Rhythm Heaven Megamix":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rhythm_Heaven_Megamix
* "Wikipedia: Rhythm Heaven Megamix":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rhythm_Heaven_Groove

title: dijeh_traversia
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] mechaverse. It first appeared in [[MSV-R: The Return of Johnny Ridden]].

[b]MSK-008S Dijeh Traversia[/b]

A [[Neo Zeon]] produced experimental variant of the [[Dijeh]] developed from [[Char's Dijeh]] to test advanced Psycommu technologies.

title: geara_doga_psycommu_test_type
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]AMS-120X Geara Doga Psycommu Test Type[/b]

A prototype experimental and heavily modified [[Geara Doga]] [[mobile_suit|MS]], it was featured in the original design series [i][[Char's Counterattack]] Mobile Suit Variations[/i].

One of the many Newtype-use mobile suits built for [[Char Aznable]]'s [[Neo Zeon]], it did not met expectations and was later used by [[Anaheim Electronics]] for developing the [[jagd_doga_quess_custom|Jagd Doga]]. Its [[beam rifle]] and torso [[beam cannon]] would also be later included as weaponry for the cutting edge [[Sazabi]] MS.

title: neo_zeon
body:
A fictional antagonist [[military]] faction from the [[Gundam]] [[science fiction]] universe. It first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] TV anime series from 1985.

The succesor faction to [[Zeon]]. Originally called [b][[axis_(gundam)|Axis]] Zeon[/b], changed its name to [b]Neo Zeon[/b] during [[gundam_zz|The First Neo Zeon War]].

They are enemies of the [[Earth Federation]], its [[earth_federation_space_forces|EFSF]] branch, [[titans_(gundam)|The Titans]] and the [[aeug|AEUG/Karaba]].

A remnant faction from the original members of the First Neo Zeon army commandered by Haman Karn escaped to Mars and renamed themselves [b]ReZeon[/b]. They appear during the events of [[Advance of Zeta Re-Boot]].

title: mangey_(sonic)
body:
A character from the animated series [i][[Sonic Prime]][/i]. He is an alternate universe variant of [[Tails (Sonic)|Miles "Tails" Prower]], residing in the Boscage Maze universe. Unlike the original Tails, Mangey exhibits feral behavior, often moving on all fours and communicating through growls.

His appearance is more rugged, featuring disheveled orange fur, a white head tuft, and distinctive vermilion-tipped ears. He also sports a fauxhawk with crimson spikes and has small tusks. His attire includes gloves wrapped with leaves, a green belt with brown pockets, and shoes made of leaves held together by ropes.

title: mecha_knuckles
body: A robotic doppelgÃ¤nger of [[Knuckles the Echidna]] in the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]]. Created by [[Dr. Eggman]], he first appears as the boss of Angel Island in [i][[Sonic Advance]][/i]. Initially, Mecha Knuckles resembles Knuckles but with magenta fur, blue eyes, and yellow gloves. Upon sustaining damage, his outer layer falls away to reveal a more mechanical form. He possesses abilities akin to Knuckles, such as gliding and the Spin Dash, and in his second form, he can launch homing missiles from his mouth.

title: sinbad_(sonic)
body:
A character from the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]], specifically appearing in [i][[Sonic and the Secret Rings]][/i]. He is an alternate universe variant of [[Knuckles the Echidna]], residing in the world of the Arabian Nights.

Sinbad's appearance mirrors Knuckles', with distinguishing attire reflecting Arabian culture: a white keffiyeh, white dishdasha with a purple belt, and gray metal wristlets. He wields a yellow-curved dagger adorned with a ruby at the handle's end.

title: knuckles_the_echidna
body:
[[Sonic the Hedgehog]]'s friend and former rival, Knuckles is a red echidna who gets his name from the spikes on his knuckles. He possesses resilience and strength, and can glide in the air. Because he had to protect the Master Emerald alone before meeting Sonic and [[tails (sonic)|Tails]], he lacked social abilities and was gullible. He has a fierce rivalry with [[Rouge the Bat]].

His seiyuu is [[Kanna Nobutoshi]].

title: staff_of_selection_(fate)
body:
The [[staff]] wielded by [[Artoria Caster (fate)|]], symbolizing her as the Fairy of Prophecy for the land of [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|Faerie Britain]]. It bears a great resemblance to [[Merlin (fate)|]]'s staff, and serves as a parallel to the [[Caliburn (fate)|Sword of Selection]].

In her [[Artoria Caster (third ascension) (fate)|third ascension]], she trades out the staff for [[Marmyadose (fate)|]] as her primary weapon in battle.

[spoiler][[Aesc (fate)|]] originally had a similar Spear of Selection, but it became corrupted after she lost faith in the fairies of Britain and she sealed it away. The various staffs she's seen with are instead ordinary staffs. This spear would later be gifted to [[Percival (fate)|]], whereupon it transformed into a [[Longinus (weapon) (fate)|Longinus]] look-alike.[/spoiler]

* !post #9051942

title: knuckles_the_dread
body:
An alternate universe, pirate-themed variant of [[Knuckles the Echidna]] from the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]] who made his debut in [i][[Sonic Prime]][/i].

Unlike the original Knuckles, who is the guardian of the Master Emerald, this variant is portrayed as a ruthless pirate captain leading a crew in a chaotic, fractured dimension. His design and demeanor reflect a swashbuckling aesthetic, complete with a sword and a more aggressive personality.

title: rengoku_(sword)_(fate)
body:
[[Okita Souji Alter (Fate)|]]'s signature [[sword]]. It has a unique hilt and a red accent on its blade, and is stored in a gold-accented sheath.

During the [[Chaldea Summer Adventure]] event, its personality gains a [[Rengoku (fate)|humanoid form]], and both itself and [[Okita Souji Alter (Swimsuit Saber) (fate)|]] utilize modified versions of Rengoku's sword form. During the [[GUDAGUDA Shin Yamatai-koku]] event, he possesses her body as the dominant personality under the name [[Rengoku Alter (fate)|]], resulting in her gaining a [[flat chest]].

Not to be confused with other ordinary [[katana]]s that she wields.

h4. Appearance

* !post #9013147
* !post #3158574: [[Okita Souji Alter (Fate)|]] wielding Rengoku
* !post #5590964: [[Okita Souji Alter (Fate)|]] wielding an ordinary katana in her right hand with Rengoku sheathed at her waist
* !post #9056663: The divided forms wielded by [[Okita Souji Alter (Swimsuit Saber) (fate)|]] and [[Rengoku (fate)|]]

title: longinus_(weapon)_(fate)
body:
A [[spear]] named after its original wielder, [[Lucius Longinus (fate)|]]. It was an ordinary spear until it stabbed the side of [[Jesus|Jesus Christ]] during his [[crucifixion]] and became a holy relic due to being coated in the messiah's blood. It would later be wielded by [[Percival (Fate)|]] and become one of his noble phantasms.

[spoiler]In the British lostbelt, [[Aesc (fate)|]]'s [[Staff of Selection (fate)|Spear of Selection]] transformed into a Longinus look-alike after it was gifted to the Lostbelt version of Percival by [[Aurora (fate)|]].[/spoiler]

* !post #9051974

title: goddess_of_war_(fate)
body:
[b]War God's Military Sash[/b]

A sash modeled from the war banner belonging [[Ares (fate)|]], with different versions possessed by his daughters [[Penthesilea (fate)|]] and [[Hippolyta (fate)|]]. Penthesilea's has a [[fur trim]] and resembles a [[cape]], which she wears around her waist like a [[showgirl skirt]], while Hippolyta wears hers as a [[stola]] or [[sash]].

* !post #8998424

[[Mordred (Fate/Apocrypha)|]]'s [[helmet]], given to her by [[Morgan le Fay (fate)|]]. Its enchantment allows for her identity as [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|King Arthur]]'s illegitimate child to be hidden, along with other information about her parameters.

title: zelretch_sword
body:
One of [[kischur zelretch schweinorg|Zelretch]]'s Mystic codes and his main weapon. Commonly referred to as the "Jeweled Sword Zelretch" it's a jagged ceremonial ritual dagger with jewels encrusted in its hilt. The sword allows the user to channel into the blade potentially infinite magical energy which can then be fired off in a blinding stream of light.

Zelretch carries the original, and he has left blueprints of the sword with the Tohsaka family as a sort of long-term homework that he expects will take many generations. During [[Heaven's Feel]], the sword is created by using these blueprints and other plot devices and [[Tohsaka Rin]] brandishes it [spoiler]to fight [[Matou Sakura]][/spoiler] in the climax of the route. The sword created is inferior to the original, and using it causes Rin's muscles to be damaged.

* !post #8978747

title: god_force_(fate)
body:
[b]Five Soldiers of the War God[/b]

[[Lu Bu (fate)|]]'s [[halberd]] and [[Noble Phantasm (fate)|]]. It was designed by [[Chen Gong (fate)|]] and can transform into 6 different forms (known as "Forces"), [b]Slash[/b], [b]Thrust[/b], [b]Blunt Strike[/b], [b]Sweep[/b], [b]Parry[/b], and [b]Shoot[/b]. Due to his Mad Enhancement from being summoned in the Berserker-class, Lu Bu can only use the Halberd and Shoot functions.

It has been shown as a [[halberd]], a [[bow (weapon)|]] and [[arrow (projectile)|]], [[spiked gauntlets]], [[tonfa]]s, a broad[[sword]], [[kusarigama]], and a [[scythe|war scythe]].

[[Chen Gong (fate)|]] uses an [[arrow (projectile)|]] constructed from it when firing his Noble Phantasm [b]Two-Pronged Formation[/b].

* !post #8983225

title: dijeh
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] mechaverse. It first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] TV anime series from 1985.

[b]MSK-008 Dijeh[/b]

A competent and powerful ground combat [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by the [[AEUG|Karaba]] resistance organization on Earth by using a heavily modified AEUG [[Rick Dias]], during The Gryps War against the brutal and oppresive [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]]. While its visor might resemble a monoeye, it has a [[rx-78-2 gundam|Gundam]]-esque faceplate underneath it. 

One unit was piloted by [[Amuro Ray]] during [[zeta_Gundam|the Gryps Conflict]], and many of them were deployed with degrees of success by PMCs in [[gundam_narrative|UC 0097]] - a full 10 years after its introduction, a testament to its effectiveness in MS combat.

h4. See also

* [[Rick Dijeh Kai]]
* [[Dijeh SE-R]]
* [[Char's Dijeh]]

body:

Also known as the [b]Modified Rick Dijeh[/b], the Rick Dijeh Kai is a repaired and improved [[Rick Dijeh]], itself a heavily modified [[Dijeh]].

body:
The default male skin for the player in [[Minecraft]].

Steve has [[blue eyes]], [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]] and [[brown hair|dark brown]] or [[black hair|black]] [[very short hair|short hair]]. He wears an [[aqua shirt|aqua]] [[shirt|T-shirt]] and [[blue pants]]. 

Playable in [i][[super_smash_bros.|Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]][/i]. Portrayed by [[Jack Black]] in [i][[A Minecraft Movie]][/i].

h4. See also

* [[Alex (minecraft)|]]
* [[List of Minecraft Characters]]

title: warm_colored
body:
Images with a color palette primarily consisting of warm colors: red, orange, yellow, and pink. This tag should not be used for images exclusively focused on a single color.

Purple and green are transitionary colors and certain shades can still fall under this tag when paired with warm colors, even though they are traditionally considered cool colors.

h4. See also

* [[analogous colors]]
* [[cool colored]]

title: cool_colored
body:
Images with a color palette primarily consisting of cool colors: green, blue, aqua, and purple. This tag should not be used for images exclusively focused on a single color.

h4. See also

* [[analogous colors]]
* [[warm colored]]

title: rei_(hokuto_no_ken)
body:
[b]Rei[/b] ([b]ãƒ¬ã‚¤[/b]) is a character from [[Hokuto no Ken]].

He is the successor of Nanto Suichou Ken (å—æ–—æ°´é³¥æ‹³, "South Star Waterfowl Fist"), which is said to be the most elegant of the Nanto Seiken styles, and represents the Star of Justice (ç¾©æ˜Ÿ, Gi-sei). While away on training, his home village was attacked by a "Man with Seven Scars" (who was actually [[Jagi]] imposted as his brother [[Kenshiro]]), who killed Rei's parents and kidnapped his sister [[Airi_(hokuto_no_ken)|Airi]].

Rei later accompanied with [[Kenshiro]] in a quest to taking back his sister (who's later being sold as slave). After Jagi is defeated and knowing the truth about "Man with Seven Scars", Rei later became a close friend with Kenshiro and helped him in a quest to find his lost adopted brother, [[Toki (hokuto no ken)|]].

Voiced by Shiozawa Kaneto.

title: jojo_no_kimyou_na_bouken
body:
Known in the west as [b]JoJo's Bizarre Adventure[/b]. 

An ongoing manga by [[Araki Hirohiko]], and adapted into an anime series by David Production. The series is known for its references to Western music, bizarre [[Stand (jojo)|]] powers, over-the-top scenes which spawned numerous [[meme]]s, and the [[fabulous|glam style]] of the characters and [[JoJo pose|poses]].

The anime adaptation is known for its use of written manga-styled [[sound effects]] (particularly [[menacing (jojo)|ã‚´ã‚´ã‚´ã‚´ (menacing)]]), and for using a western classic song as an ending theme, especially the first two parts' ending theme "[i]Roundabout[/i]":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cPCLFtxpadE by the British progressive rock band [[Yes (band)|]].

The story chronicles the adventures of the Joestar bloodline, taking place over many "Parts", each starring a protagonist whose nickname is "JoJo".

h4. List of works

h5. Main timeline

* Part 1: [[Phantom Blood]]
* Part 2: [[Battle Tendency]]
* Part 3: [[Stardust Crusaders]]
* Part 4: [[Diamond wa Kudakenai]]

title: ford_explorer
body:
The [b]Ford Explorer[/b] is a series of [[sports utility vehicle|SUVs]] manufactured by [[ford|Ford Motor Company]]. It has gone through six generations of product evolution, and the 5th and 6th generation Explorer are famous in reality as one of the more common [[police car|police]] [[car|vehicles]] in the United States.

h1. See also
* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

title: ford
body:
A manufacturer of motor vehicles based in the [[United States|United States of America]]. It was founded by [[Henry Ford]] on June 16, 1903.

Ford is the parent company of [[Lincoln (company)|]], and retains their trademarks for the now-defunct [[Mercury (company)|]] brand. They also previously owned several still-active foreign car brands, namely [[Volvo]], [[Mazda]], [[Aston Martin]], [[Jaguar (car)|]], and [[Land Rover]].

title: en_(dorohedoro)
body:
One of the main "antagonists" of the seinen [i][[Dorohedoro]][/i].

He is the boss of a maffia-like organization in the world of Mages. He is quite nice to his subordinates. His magic fume involves transforming everything in mushrooms.

Among his subordinates are [[shin_(dorohedoro)|Shin]], [[noi (dorohedoro)|Noi]], [[Chota]], [[fujita (dorohedoro)|Fujita]] and [[ebisu (dorohedoro)|Ebisu]]. [[kikurage (dorohedoro)|Kikurage]] is his pet.

He loves eating mushrooms.

Voiced by Horiuchi Ken'yuu.

title: windows_10
body:
A major release of the [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] operating system developed by [[Microsoft]] that was released to retail on July 29, 2015. 

As a successor to Windows 8.1, it became available to users of [[Windows 7]], [[Windows 8]] and 8.1 as a free upgrade.

It received praise for its return to a familiar desktop interface and improved software, though it faced criticism for mandatory updates and privacy concerns. Unlike previous releases, Windows 10 receives ongoing updates at no additional cost, with enterprise users having the option for long-term support.

Support for Windows 10 editions which are not in the Long-Term Servicing Channel (LTSC) is set to end on October 14, 2025.

It was succeeded by [[Windows 11]], which was released on October 5, 2021.

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: Windows 10":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windows_10]
* "Download Windows 10 - microsoft.com":[https://www.microsoft.com/en-au/software-download/windows10]

title: ford_gt
body:
The Ford GT is a mid-engine two-seater sports car manufactured and marketed by American automobile manufacturer [[Ford]] as a road legal homage to the [[Ford GT40]] road car. The first iteration of the modern Ford GT was produced from 2004 to 2006, while a second iteration ran from 2017 to 2022. The second iteration had various enhanced track-only variants, including the final Ford GT Mk IV.

Prior to the release of the road car, Ford presented a concept for a modernized take on the GT40 in 1995 with the [[Ford GT90]], though that take on the model did not reach production.

title: yoshida_ayumi
body: A classmate of [[Edogawa Conan]]'s, a cheerful and enthusiastic girl who loves to solve cases with her friends Conan, [[Tsuburaya Mitsuhiko]], [[Kojima Genta]] and [[Haibara Ai]].

title: haibara_ai
body:
A girl who used to be called [[Miyano Shiho]] and was in the Black Organization under the code name Sherry. After the Organization kills her older sister [[Miyano Akemi]], Shiho takes the same drug that shrunk [[Kudou Shin'ichi]] and likewise becomes a child herself to escape, renaming herself Haibara Ai. She is blunt and cool-headed, but becomes frightened whenever the Organization is discussed or nearby.

Her name comes from fictional detective [[Cordelia Gray]] (ç° = gray) and Sherlock Holmes character [[Irene Adler]].

title: takagi_wataru_(meitantei_conan)
body:
A police detective and [[Satou Miwako]]'s love interest. He is trustworthy, but tends to be nervous when trying to be casual with Miwako.

He is named after the voice actor [[Takagi Wataru (voice Actor)|]], who voices him as well as [[Kojima Genta]], after the voice actor ad-libbed his own name as the (then unnamed) character's name.

title: satou_miwako
body: A police detective and [[Takagi Wataru (meitantei conan)|]]'s love interest. She's very boyish and knows martial arts, but is terrified of ferris wheels due to what happened to her colleague [[Matsuda Jinpei]].

title: tenkuu_no_otome-tachi
body:
2008 manga series in the [[World Witches Series]] universe. Written by [[Shimada Fumikane]] and drawn by [[Tanaka Yuki]], it was serialised in Comp Ace from July to December.
It follows [[Miyafuji Yoshika]] shortly before she joined [[501st Joint Fighter Wing]], but its events are no longer considered canonical to the wider Witches universe.

title: futanari
body:
A female character with male genitalia.

In the context of Danbooru, the image does not need to directly show whether or not they have female genitalia. If you can visually confirm the lack of a [[pussy|vagina]], tag [[futa without pussy]]. If you can visually confirm a vagina, [[penis]], and [[testicles]], tag [[full-package futanari]].

It is [b]not[/b] related to real transgender or intersex, but is a purely fantasy-based depiction of hermaphroditism.

Futanari is not to be tagged with either [[hetero]], [[yuri]] or [[yaoi]].

h4. Related tags

h6. Pairings

* [[futa with female]]
* [[futa with male]]
** [[futa on male]]
** [[male on futa]]
* [[futa with futa]]
* [[futa with newhalf]]

h6. Types 

* [[full-package futanari]]: penis, vagina, & testicles
* [[intravaginal futanari]]: penis coming out of vagina
* [[futa without pussy]]: penis, testicles, no vagina

h6. Other

* [[ejaculating while penetrated]]
* [[futanari pov]]
* [[futasub]]
* [[huge clitoris]]
* [[penis growth]]
* [[pseudopenis]]

h4. See also

* [[cuntboy]]: male body with a vagina only
* [[male futanari]]: male body with a vagina and penis
* [[genderswap]]: male/female-to-futanari

title: vagina_dentata
body:
When a woman's [[pussy]] contains [[sharp teeth]]; [i]vagina dentata[/i] is Latin for [i]toothed vagina[/i]. It's derived from an old wives tale designed to caution men of having intercourse with a woman they don't know lest they risk emasculation. On Danbooru, this often refers to [[monster girl|monster girls]] with teeth on their vagina.

The movie [i]Teeth[/i] features a protagonist with vagina dentata.

h4.See also

* [[Gaping Dragon]]
* "Teeth (film)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teeth_%282007_film%29
* "Vagina Dentata":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vagina_dentata

title: vector_art
body:
Vector graphics are a form of computer graphics in which visual images are created directly from geometric shapes defined on a Cartesian plane, such as points, lines, curves and polygons. The associated mechanisms may include vector display and printing hardware, vector data models and file formats, as well as the software based on these data models (especially graphic design software, computer-aided design, and geographic information systems). Vector graphics are an alternative to raster or bitmap graphics, with each having advantages and disadvantages in specific situations.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vector_graphics

title: petilil
body:
[[pokemon|PokÃ©mon]] #548 in the National PokÃ©Dex, a Grass type PokÃ©mon.
Petilil is a plant-like PokÃ©mon that resembles a plant bulb, such as an onion. It is primarily light green. Its head is tipped with three oblong leaves that are very bitter. However, these leaves possess revitalizing effects. Its crescent-shaped white face, seemingly lacking of a nose or mouth, has brown eyes shaped like elongated ovals. 

It evolves into [[Lilligant]] when exposed to a [[Sun Stone (pokemon)|]] (e.g. post #6303967)
Japanese Name: [b]Churine[/b]

Prior PokÃ©mon: [[Whimsicott]]
Next PokÃ©mon: [[Lilligant]]

title: classic_tails
body: An alternate, retro version of [[Tails (Sonic)|Miles "Tails" Prower]]â€”[[Sonic the Hedgehog]]'s loyal two-tailed fox sidekick. He represents the characterâ€™s classic design from earlier eras of the Sonic franchise and is often depicted as the younger or original version from a different timeline or dimension. In titles like [i][[Sonic Generations]][/i], Classic Tails appears alongside Modern Tails, emphasizing the evolution of the character while maintaining his iconic abilities, like using his twin tails to fly.

title: freddy_krueger
body: The killer from the [[horror (theme)|]] film series [i][[A Nightmare On Elm Street]][/i]. The malignant spirit of a child-killer who was killed when the parents of Elm Street took the law into their own hands after he got off on a technicality, Freddy seeks revenge upon them by going after their children. He does this by attacking his victims in the dream world, any damage that he inflicts in a dream crossing over into the real world, meaning that if someone dies in a dream he is invading, they die for real. One of his trademarks is the [[claw (weapon)|clawed glove]]  that he wears on his right hand, which he uses as his primary weapon.

title: rei_no_pool
body:
[b]Rei no pool[/b] (ä¾‹ã®ãƒ—ãƒ¼ãƒ«, lit. "the usual pool"), officially called the[b] Hanazono Room[/b], is that indoor swimming [[pool]] with angled solarium windows which can be seen in just about every pool-related Japanese adult video ever.

It is located on the top floor of a building in [[Shinjuku (tokyo)|]], and was formerly part of a private penthouse apartment during the area's economic boom. It's now owned by a company that rents locations for video shoots. Surprisingly for a studio frequently used to film porn, it overlooks an elementary school.

The pool virtually ceased being available for JAV shoots in 2020 due to the rising cost of facility maintenance expenses to clean up afterwards. The pool remains open for non-AV shoots such as gravure and non-pornographic shoots.

Despite its reputation as a common location for JAVs, the pool has recently been featured in a handful of mainstream productions as well, including an episode of [[Kamen Rider Fourze (Series)|]].

h4. Examples

* !post #8735471

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Real world locations]]

body: Character(s) located on a rooftop. [[rooftop|Rooftops]] are roofs purpose-built to be walked on, a feature common in many Japanese schools, certain styles of apartment blocks, buildings with pools, gardens, lounges atop them, etc. Do not use [[on rooftop]] with [[on roof]]. On_roof should only be used together with [[roof]], the tag for roofs not intended for human traversal, like those present on traditional homes or pagodas. (post #5891954) h4. title: finger_counting
body:
A hand gesture where a character indicates a number with their fingers raised. Some artists use this for [[countdown]]s, [[anniversary|anniversaries]], and [[milestone celebration|milestone celebrations]].

Common gestures used to indicate various numbers include:

* Zero: [[ok sign]] (with one hand) or [[circle hands]] (with two hands)
* One: [[index finger raised]] or [[thumbs up]]
* Two: [[v]]
* Three: [[w]] or [[middle w]]
* Four: [[number four (asl)|]] (with one hand) or [[double v]] (with two hands)
* Five: [[open hand]] (with one hand) or [[v]] plus [[w]] (with two hands)
* Ten: [[open hands]]

body:

Sailor dresses are distinct from [[serafuku]] in that they are a one-piece garment, whereas serafuku consist of a shirt and a skirt or shorts.

title: kazami_yuuka
body:
The "Flower Master of the Four Seasons".

Final Boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Lotus Land Story]][/i] and later a recurring playable character, as well as the fourth [[Kazami Yuuka (PC-98)|PC-98]] generation character after [[Hakurei Reimu]], [[Kirisame Marisa]] and [[Alice Margatroid]] to reappear in the Windows generation (specifically in [i][[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]][/i]).

A highly dangerous youkai with the power to manipulate [[flower]]s, and reputed creator and original wielder of the [[Master Spark]] (which Marisa later "borrowed"). Hinted by [[Hieda no Akyuu]] to exhibit a rather polite facade, provided she or her flowers are not harmed. Once described by ZUN as "Youkai moe~", possibly meant as a pun given that the literal meaning of moe is "budding" and Yuuka controls flowers. Yuuka's place of residence is unknown in canon, but is generally assumed to be the [[Garden of the Sun]], where she tends a [[flower field|massive field]] of [[sunflower]]s, and it is known she used to occupy the Dream World mansion [[Mugenkan]] with her then-retainer [[Elly (touhou)|]]. Frequently portrayed in fan works as the [[sadism|Ultimate Sadistic Creature]] (USC), as a bloodthirsty psychopath, or as tsundere.  Usually some combination of the first two (or of all three).  Alternately, she is often depicted as lonely due to this reputation or as very friendly to [[Team 9 (touhou)|]] and other children.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]] with [[medium bangs|medium-length bangs]] and [[red eyes]], sometimes [[yellow eyes|yellow]]. Her outfit consists of an [[open vest|open]] [[plaid vest|plaid]] [[red vest]] over a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] tied with a [[yellow ascot]]. To complete her [[skirt set]] is a matching [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[red skirt]] with [[frilled skirt|frills]] or [[plaid pants|plaid]] [[red pants]]. Her footwear is usually [[white socks]] with [[red footwear|red]] [[mary janes]] or [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]]. She usually carries her [[pink umbrella|pink]] [[parasol]].

h4. Fan-made Variations

* "Noukarin":[http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%81%AE%E3%81%86%E3%81%8B%E3%82%8A%E3%82%93] (Farmer-Yuukarin): Originally a type of [[Yukkuri Shiteitte Ne]], unusually depicted with a full body instead of just as a head.  Now this word means Kazami Yuuka wearing a [[straw hat]].  Noukarin is frequently depicted with an acoustic [[guitar]] and/or with an almost impenetrable rural accent. 
* "Bakerin":[http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%81%B9%E3%83%BC%E3%81%8B%E3%82%8A%E3%82%93] (Bakery-Yuukarin): A recent variant of Kazami Yuuka who makes [[bread]] in her own bakery named "[[Bakery]] Kazami".  "A certain tweet":http://twitter.com/matsurisyndrome/status/51104783376990208 caused this trend.
* [[Kazami Youka (yokochou)|]]: a younger and more upbeat version of Yuuka; from [[yokochou]]'s work.

h4. See also

* [[Kazami Yuuka (Seihou)]]
* Pool #2582:  Touhou - Nobody Likes Yuuka
* Pool #2739:  Touhou - Changing Seasons; representing summer
* Pool #1053:  Touhou - Old Maids Alliance; former member

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Yuuka Kazami":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Yuuka_Kazami

title: kochiya_sanae
body:
The "Human of the Worshipped Wind". Stage 5 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Mountain of Faith]] and later a recurring playable character. Has the power to create miracles.

She is the miko of the [[Moriya Shrine]] under the patronage of [[Yasaka Kanako]] and also direct descendant of the shrine's original deity, [[Moriya Suwako]]. Sanae and her deities moved into [[Gensokyo]] due to waning faith of humans from the outside world, making her one of the only humans from the 21st century. Recent games in the main series as well as certain side works consider her a type of deity in her own right.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]], with a [[single sidelock]]. Her eyes are [[green eyes|green]] or [[blue eyes|blue]]. In her hair are [[snake hair ornament|snake]] and [[frog hair ornament]]s and a [[single hair tube]]. She is frequently depicted with [[large breasts]]. She wears a [[nontraditional miko]] outfit consisting of a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] (that is sometimes depicted as a [[crop top]]) with [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[white sleeves]], a [[long skirt|long]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[blue skirt]], [[white socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]], her signature [[gohei]] is different from the norm as it has straight paper decorations. As of [[Unfinished Dream of All Living Ghost]], she is additionally shown with [[wings]]. Doujins sometimes portray her wearing a modern [[school uniform]] as homage to her origins.

She is a generally good, if somewhat naive and clumsy, girl, but also an "overeager youkai hunter":/pool/show/4639 (leading to her portrayal of frequently bullying [[Tatara Kogasa]] after a scene in [[Undefined Fantastic Object]] where Sanae gave scathing words against the latter).

She is occasionally depicted as a [[retro games sanae (meme)|generation behind]] due to [[Mountain of Faith]] first releasing in 2007.

She is sometimes called "[[player 2|2P]] [[Hakurei Reimu|Reimu]]" or "[[Miko]] [[Luigi]]" due to Reimu's red outfit compared to Sanae's green outfit.

h4. Example

* !post #8091655: Usual Appearance
* !post #6586874: [[Unfinished Dream of All Living Ghost]]

h4. See also

* [[Retro games Sanae (meme)|]]
* Pool #4639 - For depictions of Sanae in her Youkai Extermination Mode

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Sanae Kochiya":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Sanae_Kochiya

title: hakurei_reimu
body:
The "Wonderful Shrine Maiden of Paradise" and main character of the [[Touhou]] series.

An easygoing but dutiful [[nontraditional miko|miko]] and good friend to fellow protagonist [[Kirisame Marisa]]; her cool, detached facade belies a sympathetic personality which often wins her the friendship of her former enemies, such as [[Remilia Scarlet]]. Reimu takes care of the rundown [[Hakurei Shrine]], which lay near [[Gensokyo]]'s border with the outside world and acts as its main portal, and fights using her [[holding gohei|gohei]], [[ofuda]], and her family heirloom, [[yin yang orb]]s.

Famous for her laid-back disposition and exposed [[armpits]], as well as the first subject (together with Marisa) of a notorious [[2channel]] meme - "[[Yukkuri shiteitte ne|]]!!!".

Her hair color is usually [[brown hair|brown]] or [[black hair|black]] of nearly every length and her eye colors varies between [[red eyes|red]], [[black eyes|black]], or [[brown eyes|brown]]. Her signature accessories are her [[frilled bow|frilled]] [[red bow|red]] [[hair bow]], her [[frilled hair tubes]] on her [[sidelocks]], and her [[yellow ascot]]. Her outfit is a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[red shirt]] (that is sometimes depicted as a [[crop top]] or otherwise baring [[midriff]]) with a [[frilled shirt collar|frilled collar]], [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[white sleeves]] with a [[ribbon-trimmed sleeves|ribbon trim]], a [[skirt set|matching]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[red skirt]], [[white socks]], and either [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]] or [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]].

title: mask_bikini
body:
A [[mouth mask]] worn [[mask on breasts|on the breasts]] as a [[bra]] or a [[bikini]] top.

This is typically is shown in various ways, but generally in a creative ad hoc fashion involving tying, interlocking, or otherwise binding multiple masks together to be worn as a larger outfit (see post #3830413), sometimes also incorporating [[mask panties]]. Ironically, the character involved may or may not additionally being wearing a mask properly over their face. This theme developed in response to the [[coronavirus pandemic]] of 2020 where mask usage was brought into stark focus.

For the converse of this tag, where a [[bra]] or bikini top is used as a [[mask]], see [[bra on head]] or [[bikini top on head]]. For bikini tops that aren't actually made of mouth masks, but which adopt the specific strapless design associated with mask bikinis, see [[eyepatch bikini]].

h4. See also

* [[mask on crotch]]
* [[mask panties]]

title: single-shoulder_bikini
body:
A bikini with an asymmetrical, diagonal-shaped neckline, leaving a portion of the upper chest area and at least one shoulder [[bare shoulders|bare]]. These bikinis are typically supported by a [[single sleeve]] or a [[single strap]] on one shoulder while the other is left bare. The neckline of the bikini starts on top of one shoulder and ends underneath the armpit between the torso and opposite arm.

Examples include post #6542221, post #3736121, post #5350222, post #4230737, post #2936932, post #3659232, etc.

Do [b]not[/b] confuse this tag for [[off-shoulder bikini]]s that expose one bare shoulder, or a regular bikini with its [[strap slip|strap(s) slipping off from the shoulders]].

h5."Visual chart":[https://files.catbox.moe/9dzd5o.png] demonstrating what outfits qualify as a "single-shoulder shirt/dress/sweater/bikini/etc."

title: hime_cut
body:
A hairstyle consisting of [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair]], [[blunt bangs]], and [[sidelocks]] with [[blunt ends]].

All elements must be present to be considered a hime cut. The hair must be long and straight and the [[bangs]] and [[sidelocks]] must have blunt ends.

As the name suggests, the style is thought to have originated, or at least become common, in the Imperial court during the Heian Period of Japanese history, when noble women would sometimes [[absurdly long hair|grow out their hair for their entire lives]].

title: ra's_mirror
body: [B]Ra's Mirror[/b], alternatively referred to as the [b]Mirror of Light[/b], is a recurring key item in the [i][[Dragon Quest]][/i] franchise. It is a circular [[mirror]] with a gold and green palette. First appearing in [i][[Dragon Quest II]][/i], the mirror is able to project the true form of those who it is pointed at, such as reverting the [[Princess of Moonbrook]] back to a human after she was cursed to take the form of a [[dog]].

title: sports_panties
body:
Simple panties with no frills, lace-trimming or bows, with a single main color, often black, grey, or white. The waistband is thicker than normal and almost always a different color, usually white or black, and occasionally includes writing. Frequently worn with [[sports bra]]s.

h4. See also

title: naga_(nikke)
body:
A character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. A member of [[dazzling_pearl_(nikke)|Dazzling Pearl]] along with [[Tia (nikke)|Tia]].

The spiritual glue that holds Dazzling Pearl together. She dotes on the forgetful Tia much like an older sister does to ensure that she remembers things. Appears mature on a regular basis, but if an accessory catches her eye, she often indulges in impulse purchases and overspending.

She is a [[dark-skinned female]] and has [[yellow eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied in a [[side ponytail]] along with [[large breasts]]. Being a [[gyaru]], Naga's outfit is a [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[crop top|cropped]] [[white shirt]] with [[necktie]] (which has a [[see-through bra|see-through]] [[black bra]]), [[highleg panties]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], a pair of [[loose socks]] and [[black footwear|black shoes]].

Illustrator: [[Dfm (darknessdfm)|DarknessDFM]]

h4. Skins 

* !post #6729732: Default
* !post #7936130: [[Naga (Elegant Date) (nikke)|Elegant Date]]

title: kioh_gyoku
body:
Kioh Gyoku (ç¨€ç¿ç‰, lit. "Rare Venerable Orb") is a vertical-scrolling danmaku shoot 'em up, and is the second official game in the [[Seihou|Seihou Project]] by "Shunsatsu sare do?" (at time part of Amusement Makers). It was released specifically for the Windows operating system around December time in 2001. It is a unique game where two players indirectly battle one another by charging and releasing charge attacks and bombs upon the other player, similar in the style of Phantasmagoria of Dim.Dream.

https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Kioh_Gyoku

title: seihou
body:
"è¥¿æ–¹" (Japanese for "west") 

A series of doujin vertical shooter games created by the members of "Shunsatsu sare do?", featuring futuristic themes with science. It's currently no longer produced, with "Ponchi/PBG":https://twitter.com/pbghogehoge and co. instead currently working on "[i]SUPER Mate Mate Laser[/i]":[https://ss-do.sakura.ne.jp/#/games/smml].

It's known among groups that Seihou is a "sister series" to the [[Touhou]] Project due to being its opposite conceptually, right down to its name, Seihou, meaning "western", as opposed to Touhou, which means "eastern". [[ZUN (artist)|]] has contributed music to the series, and three Touhou characters also appear in Seihou as guests. 

[[Samidare (rebrank)|]] is neither a Seihou nor Touhou game, but rather a Project Blank game. However, it contains elements of each and both Seihou and Touhou characters appear in it. It was created by the members of RebRank, who, just like "Shunsatsu sare do?" and Team Shanghai Alice, branched from Amusement Makers.

h4. Games

* ç§‹éœœç‰ ([[Shuusou Gyoku]]) - "source code":[https://ss-do.sakura.ne.jp/#/diary/93] released c. early February 2019
* ç¨€ç¿ç‰ ([[Kioh Gyoku]])
* å¹¡ç´«ç«œ ([[Banshiryuu]])

title: oversized_animal
body:
An animal or [[creature]] that's much larger than it would be in real life: for example, a housecat the size of a horse or even a house.

Does not necessarily apply if a person happens to be unusually tiny in comparison to the animal. In that case, you may just be looking at a [[miniboy]] or [[minigirl]].

h4. See also

* [[giant snake]]

title: renegade_knucks
body:
A character from [i][[Sonic Prime]][/i] who appears as an alternate version of [[Knuckles the Echidna]] from the world of New Yoke City.

In terms of appearance, Renegade Knucks shares similarities with the main Sonic universe's Knuckles but has some distinct differences, including scars over his dreadlock-like spines, an 'X'-shaped scar on his forehead, and wears different attire including a black beanie with the Resistance's symbol, red and black boots, and black and green gauntlet-like accessories on his gloves.

title: shiranami_ramune_(4th_costume)
body:
The 4th/loungewear [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[VSPO!]]'s [[Shiranami Ramune]].

This simple and "chill" [[official alternate costume|costume]] consisted mainly of her wearing [[white camisole]], [[denim shorts]], and a pair of [[white sneakers]]. Then she would cover her torso with:
* an [[open shirt|open]] [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]]
* a [[blue sweater|blue]] [[cropped sweater]]

For accessory, she wears a [[sunglasses]], [[mismatched earrings]], [[multiple necklaces]] and [[multiple rings]].

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:
* [[Short hair|Short]] [[blue hair]]
* [[Medium hair|Medium-length hair]] tied into [[twin braids]]
* [[Long Hair]] with her [[braided bangs|bangs braided]], showing her [[forehead]]

title: kilo_(nikke)
body:
A character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. She is unique in that she fights while piloting a [[mecha]], a sentient robot of her own design named [[talos (nikke)|T.A.L.O.S.]]. In her own official art she is only briefly visible.

She is a [[petite]] girl with [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] and yellow-green eyes. She has very [[small breasts]] (in fanart, she may range from [[flat chest]] to [[medium breasts]]). She wears a [[shrug]] with a [[fur trim|fur-trimmed]] collar and a black [[microskirt]] over a gray [[leotard]] and [[pantyhose]]. She is currently the sole member of the squad "Heavy Gram".

title: gauze
body:
A piece of fabric used to cover wounds, generally on an injury too large for a [[bandaid]].   
Gauze often comes as a square pad and is [[tape|taped]] onto the skin, though self adhesive versions do exist.

It can also come in rolls that when applied become [[bandages]].

title: finana_ryugu
body:
A [[Nijisanji EN]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]], part of the first wave [[LazuLight]] and designed by [[Gilse]]. She is sometimes depicted as a traditional [[mermaid]], but this tag should not be added to posts unless she is given a fish tail in place of her legs. 

She is a [[small breasts|small-chested]] [[fish girl]] (canonically a "Tropical Mermaid of Divine Water Dragon descent":[https://youtu.be/3JAXcwDydNI?t=669], despite having little to none of the associated body features) that has [[purple eyes]] and  [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] with [[purple flower|purple]] [[hair flower]]s, a [[crown]] on top and a set of [[head fins]] in place of ears. 

h4. Costumes

title: shiranami_ramune_(2nd_costume)
body:
The 2nd/[[school uniform]] [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[VSPO!]]'s [[Shiranami Ramune]].

It consists of a [[red cardigan]] with [[argyle sweater|argyle print sleeves]], which can be removed, worn over a [[white shirt]] with [[short sleeves]] and a [[black sailor collar]], a [[white bow|white]] [[bow choker]], a [[aqua skirt|aqua]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[fishnet pantyhose]] worn underneath [[white leg warmers|white]] [[fluffy legwear|fluffy]] [[leg warmers]] and [[white boots]]. There are also many [[heart]] shaped buttons and charms, [[heart earrings]] and a [[cat hat]].

She has 2 [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:
* [[short hair|Short]] [[blue hair]] tied into [[double bun]]s

title: digimon_adventure
body:
The first [[Digimon]] series. Seven ordinary kids are caught up in a strange snowstorm while attending summer camp and get sucked through a portal into the Digital World, a fantasy world populated by sentient monsters called [[Digimon (creature)|]]. Armed with the mysterious "Digivices" and seven Digimon who are sworn to protect them, the kids try to survive in this new and exotic world until they can find a way home.

h4. Characters

* [[Ishida Yamato]] (Matt)
* [[Izumi Koshiro]] (Izzy)
* [[Kido Jo]] (Joe)
* [[Tachikawa Mimi]]
* [[Takaishi Takeru]] (T.K.)
* [[Takenouchi Sora]]
* [[Yagami Hikari]] (Kari Kamiya)
* [[Yagami Taichi]] (Tai Kamiya)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digimon_Adventure_(1999_TV_series)

title: w.d._gaster
body:
A dummied-out character in [[Undertale]] that can normally only be found through hacking.

[spoiler]The previous royal scientist who, among other things, created the CORE and fell into "his creation," resulting in him being scattered across time and space and forgotten by almost everyone in the underground. He is also thought to be connected to [[Sans (undertale)|]] due to the skull-shaped beam cannons that he wields in his boss fight being named "[[gasterblaster]]" within the game's files, and is generally assumed in most speculation to be Sans and [[Papyrus (Undertale)| Papyrus]]' older brother or father.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]Because any information relevant to him, or even any mention of his name and (former) existence, in the game can normally only be found through hacking, much of the information circulated about Gaster is conjecture. His appearance is commonly speculated to be that of the mysterious figure who looks similar to [[Uboa]] appearing in one of the game's dummied-out rooms.[/spoiler]

title: liacon_(rinkou_ashelia)
body: Fan mascot of [[Phase Connect]]'s [[Rinkou Ashelia]]. It's a pink [[jellyfish]]-like creature with a [[lightning bolt symbol|lightning bolt]] on its head.

title: andersen_(nikke)
body:
An NPC from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. One of the Deputy Chiefs of the Ark's Central Government Command.

While he shares the same blood as the [[Commander (nikke)|]], they are not related at all. Andersen has an unusual obsession with the Pilgrims, as he built a Tribe Tower for them, and seeks to obtain information regarding their weapons, combat data, and so on. He also sees himself as a "representative" for the Pilgrims.

His name may be a reference to Hans Christian Andersen, analogous to the members of the [[Goddess (Nikke)|]] squad being named after fairy tale characters. This, his preoccupation with Pigrims and some other circumstantial evidence may hint that [spoiler]he is [[The Legendary Commander (nikke)|]] (somehow having not aged significantly in 50+ years) or connected to him in some way.[/spoiler]

title: tape_measure
body:
A long and thin strip of plastic or metal, etched with scales. The plastic tape measure is usually short (around 150 cm, although really long ones can reach hundreds of meters) and used by a tailor to take body measurements for clothes-making. The metal ones are usually longer (up to 5 meters and housed in a small dispenser to avoid cutting the hand of its user) and used by carpenters and builders. The dressmaking-related ones are commonly used in the act of [[bust measuring]].

h4. Types

* [[Cased tape measure]]
* [[Open reel tape measure]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tape measure":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tape_measure]

title: raiden_punching_armstrong_(meme)
body:
A [[quick time event]] from the 2013 video game [i][[Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance]][/i] in which the protagonist [[Raiden (metal_gear)|]] [[rapid_punches|rapidly punches]] the main villain [[steven_armstrong|Senator Steven Armstrong]] in the stomach to no effect.

The scene, often combined from the song "It Has to Be This Way":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N72U-NFu44k (better known by its first lyric "Standing Here I Realize") from the game's soundtrack, has been used as source material for image macros, video captions, GIF captions and remakes. Note that the song doesn't play in this part but rather the final phase in actual gameplay.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Raiden Punching Armstrong / Standing Here I Realize":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/raiden-punching-armstrong-standing-here-i-realize

h4. See also
* [[armstrong incoming (meme)]]
* [[nanomachines son! (meme)]]

title: girl_staring_at_guy's_chest_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originally featuring a girl staring at a man's pectoral muscle, seeming impressed by its size.

The image became a popular template among the [[bara]] community, in which the format is switched into two [[muscular male|muscular men]], with one looking at the other's large pectoral muscle, either in envy or in awe. Also occasionally used in a similar manner with female [[breast envy]] memes.

h4. External link

* "Know Your Meme: Girl staring at guy's chest":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/girl-staring-at-guys-chest]

* [[looking at pectorals]]

title: bindi
body:
A [[forehead mark]] that consists of a colored dot (or sticker) worn on the center of the forehead. It is worn by Hindus, Jains and Buddhists from the Indian subcontinent. The mark is always applied close to the eyebrows or in the middle of the forehead 

Note that China historically had a mark similar to the bindi, called the cinnabar mole (æœ±ç ‚ç—£, zhushazhi) or the dot cinnabar (ç‚¹ä¸¹ diandan). The cinnabar it was made from gave it the red pigment, but was highly toxic. It was used as a status symbol, with links to [[taoism]].

Use [[forehead mark]] or [[circle facial mark]] instead if the image has no correlation with [[Hinduism]], [[Buddhism]] or [[Jainism]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7118924

h4.See also

* [[Facial mark]]
* [[Huadian]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Bindi":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bindi_(decoration)]

title: dark_samus
body:
A being of [[Phazon]] taking on the shape of [[Samus Aran]]. She made a brief cameo appearance in the secret ending of [[Metroid Prime]], was a central character in [[Metroid Prime 2: Echoes]], and was the main antagonist in [[Metroid Prime 3: Corruption]].

After Samus defeated the [[Metroid Prime (creature)|]] on Tallon IV by absorbing Phazon and using it as a weapon against Metroid Prime, the creature began to destabilize, and in a desperate move, it absorbed her [[Phazon Suit]] and subsequently exploded. As Samus left the planet, a new creature was born from Samus' DNA and the remains of Metroid Prime, using Samus' Phazon Suit as a mold to contain its new body - the creature known as Dark Samus.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25450106: Metroid Prime 2: Echoes
* !asset #25450109: Metroid Prime 2: Echoes (Second form)
* !post #3217758: Metroid Prime 3: Corruption

title: featherine_augustus_aurora
body:
A character from [[Umineko No Naku Koro Ni]]. The Witch of the Theater, she is said to have been the Game Master for countless other games in the past, though she has long-forgotten them. She possesses a crescent-shaped device which floats around her head, serving as a memory aid which maintains traits such as her name, appearance, and personality. She has [[Ushiromiya Ange]] read the story of Dawn of the Golden Witch and challenges her to find the truth about it. She may or may not be the true form of [[Hachijou Ikuko]].

While it is not confirmed they are the same character, she is nearly identical in appearance to the character [[Eua (higurashi)|]] from the anime [[Higurashi No Naku Koro Ni]] Gou.

title: takanashi_kiara_(knight)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Takanashi Kiara]], revealed on July 24, 2023.

It consists of a [[layered dress]] [[armored dress]] styled after a [[boobplate]] with an [[underbust]] [[chest belt]], worn over a [[long_sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black_shirt|black]] [[high collar]]ed [[see-through shirt]] with [[embroidery]], a grey [[gambeson]] (with a [[zipper]] for some reason) and a [[black_skirt|black]] [[pleated_skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] [[skirt under dress|underneath]], [[vambraces]] with [[blue gloves|dark blue]] [[fingerless gloves]], a [[waist cape]] styled after wings, [[black boots|black]] [[thigh boots]] styled [[greaves]] with [[blue thighhighs]] [[thighhighs under boots|underneath]], and [[sabaton]]s. She also has an optional [[zweihander]] [[sword on back|on her back]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume both of which are decorated with a [[crystal hair ornament|crystal]] [[headpiece]] and having [[blue hair|blue]] [[colored tips]], [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[colored inner hair]]:
* [[Short hair]] with [[short hair with long locks|long]] [[sidelocks]] and [[double-parted bangs]]
* [[Long hair]] done in a [[high ponytail]]

title: william_d._porter_(azur_lane)
body:
USS William D. Porter was a Fletcher-class destroyer serving in the US Navy during WWII. She is, infamously, the "unluckiest ship of WWII". 

Her bad luck streak began when President Roosevelt, relaxing in an easy chair upon the deck of the USS Iowa, was watching an exercise that Willie Dee was a part of and Willie Dee accidentally launched a live torpedo at the USS Iowa to which the USS Iowa only barely outmaneuvered. The sailor who accidentally fired the torpedo was thrown into the brig but Roosevelt immediately pardoned him so he could get back to his duties. 

While this particular event was only the start of her ill fortune, said ill fortune apexed dramatically at her end. A Japanese kamikaze barely missed hitting the Willie Dee during the final days of the conflict, hitting the water before colliding with the ship. The momentum of the kamikaze plane, carrying a torpedo, sent the submerged plane and its now deceased pilot directly underneath the Willie Dee, where the torpedo then activated and exploded, bifurcating her and sending her under. 

Willie Dee has been with Azur Lane since the game started, but only as a loading graphic and as a temporary placeholder for other ships and the only official artwork of her is in the background of image of the other Fletchers. She has (as of April 2025) yet to be released to the player as an actual ship.

title: capable_(mad_max)
body:
A character from [[Mad Max: Fury Road]]. One of [[Immortan Joe]]'s "wives" who he keeps in his private vault in order for them to bear him non-mutated children, she along with the Wives join [[Imperator Furiosa]] to escape their imprisonment, leading to the events of the movie. 

Capable is played by Riley Keough, the granddaughter of [[Elvis Presley]].

title: the_doof_warrior
body:
A minor character in [[Mad Max: Fury Road]] that received a lot of popularity despite very limited screen time.

He is a blind, pale man wearing a red onesie. He is most notable for playing a flame-spewing [[double neck guitar]] atop [[the doof wagon]], a vehicle carrying a large wall of [[speaker]]s that accompanies [[Immortan Joe]] during the length of the film's car chase.

He is played by Australian singer iOTA while some the character's stunt were performed by Ben Smith-Petersen, who would later marry [[Capable (mad max)|]]'s actress, Riley Keough.

title: zero_suit
body:
A blue [[bodysuit]] worn by [[Samus Aran]] in the [[Metroid]] series.

The suit first appeared in [[Metroid: Zero Mission]], but later appeared in many other games. The suit's appearance differs slightly between games. In [[Metroid: Zero Mission]], the suit has black highlights on the legs. In [[Metroid: Other M]], the suit has dark blue highlights. In [[Super Smash Bros.]], the suit has glowing yellow [[high heels]].

title: mary_(quartet)
body:
Character from the 1986 [[Quartet (game)|Quartet]] arcade game by [[Sega]].

She also serves as the main protagonist in the Sega Master System version.

Her appearance in the arcade version consists of a [[red shirt|red]] [[sleeveless]] [[crop top]], a red [[bikini bottom only|bikini bottom]], [[red boots]] and [[medium hair|medium]] [[black hair]]. Her appearance in the Sega Master System version changes the bikini bottom to a [[red skirt|red]] [[miniskirt]], [[white boots|white]] [[knee boots]], and her hair is in a [[ponytail]].

It's a traditional [[dirndl]] consisting of a [[white choker|white]] [[frilled choker]], a [[green dress|green]] [[pinafore dress]] with [[square neckline]] and a [[bodice]] worn over a [[white shirt]], with [[see-through sleeves|see-through]] [[short sleeves]], an [[aqua apron|aqua]]/[[blue apron|blue]] [[waist apron]] with a [[heart print]] held with a matching [[striped sash]] tied into a [[waist bow]], aqua [[ankle strap]]s and [[sandals]].  She also has [[flower bracelet]]s and an optional [[pink jacket|pink]] [[open jacket|open]] [[blazer]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she now has a [[crown braid]] decorated with a [[flower wreath|flower]] [[head wreath|wreath]] and small [[hair flower]]s, [[double-parted bangs|double-parted]] [[blunt bangs]] forming a [[center-flap bangs|center flap]] and a pair of [[hair flaps]] and short [[sidelocks]], she also has a pair of [[bird on head|birds on her head]]. On July 2022 she got an additional hairstyle for this attire with part of her braid undone into a [[side ponytail]] going [[hair over shoulder|over her shoulder]] and [[swept bangs]].

She also has optional [[cat ears]] and [[cat tail|tail]].

On March 2024, Kiara received a "[[Frogiwawa]] [[hood]]" accessory update for this costume. However, the way the hood perfectly covered her [[bikini]] makes it appeared as if she's [[topless female|topless]].

title: takanashi_kiara_(fever_night)
body:
The 7th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Takanashi Kiara]].

It's an [[1980s fashion|80's-themed]] workout costume based on the workout costume that appeared in the music video for [[Fever Night (hololive)|]]. It consists of an [[aqua sweater]] bearing the [[KFP]] logo, with a [[white leotard|white]] [[highleg leotard]] underneath, [[pink leggings|pink]] or [[blue leggings]] / [[yoga pants]], [[white leg warmers]] and [[white sneakers]]. She also wears a pair of large [[hoop earrings]].

On February 2025 she got an update to this costume that adds an optional [[red skirt|red]] [[high-waist skirt|high waist]] [[pencil_skirt|pencil]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[wide belt|wide]] [[black belt]] and a [[pink pantyhose|pink]] [[fishnet pantyhose]], she can also remove her sweater now and got an additional hairstyle.

She has 2 [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:

* [[Medium hair]] in a [[wide ponytail|wide]] [[high ponytail]], held with a [[blue hairband|blue]][[bow hairband]].
* [[Very long hair|Very long]] [[messy hair]].

[b]Note[/b]: Do not use this tag for the other outfits featured in the original music video, nor for the outfit that inspired this costume (as it has star print, not floral print). Do not tag this costume with the music video copyright tag either, unless the image is specifically referencing the MV.

h4. Appearance

title: dorohedoro
body:
A fantasy seinen manga series drawn by Hayashida Q, which ran from 2000 to 2018. It moved between magazines during its run, starting in Monthly Ikki from 2000 to 2014 and then moving to Hibana from 2015 to 2017 and Monthly Shonen Sunday from 2017 to 2018.

Caiman is amnesiac and has the head of a crocodile. Believing that it's a Magic user's work, he tries to get back both his memories and human face by hunting Magic users.

The series is best known for its black humor and moral ambiguity.

title: nelson_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the battleship HMS [i]Nelson[/i] (pennant no. 28). Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Nomizu Iori]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[grey jacket|grey]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] closed [[cropped jacket]], short [[red necktie]] with a [[red rose]], [[black dress]], [[black thighhighs]], [[thigh strap]]s, and [[grey shoes|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. Her strictly military appearance contrasts greatly with Warspite's regal one due to their respective classes' namesakes being of admiralty and of royalty respectively. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of three hull pieces, one to her back and two to her sides, with the armament arranged asymetrically (15.2 cm twin gun mounts on her left, [[anti-aircraft gun]]s plus her funnel and mast to her back, and her three 406 mmt triple gun mounts to her right) and controlled by a [[joystick]]. She also has her real-life fire directors as [[headgear]]. 

At Kai, Nelson's jacket gains darker sleeves, and her rigging obtains a camouflage pattern. 

In the game, she is capable of a special cut-in sequence: the "Nelson Touch". It is also a "historical term":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Nelson_Touch], referring either to Vice Admiral Nelson's naval strategy that he used to great success or the broader sense of naval superiority the Royal Navy enjoyed during the 1800s after the British victory in the Battle of Trafalgar despite Vice Admiral Nelson's death during that time. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #3252873: Base
* !post #3252860: [[Nelson Kai (kancolle)|Kai]]
* !post #4158189: Fuji Speedway [[Nelson (Race Queen) (kancolle)|Race Queen]]

* !post #7036380: Christmas (unreleased, left)

title: rodney_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] battleship HMS [i]Rodney[/i] (29), drawn by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]]. 

Rodney, like her sister Nelson, has [[blue eyes]] and [[blonde hair]], though Rodney's is [[short hair|cut short]] in contrast. She wears a dark [[grey dress]], with a lighter [[grey jacket]] atop it and a [[red rose]] [[ascot]]. Her Kai form has the jacket turn [[two-tone]], and the shoulders and collar turn dark grey. 

Like Nelson's, Rodney's [[rigging]] is arranged in three pieces in an asymmetrical fashion, but in a reverse arrangement to that of Nelson: main battery turrets and [[joystick]] control to Rodney's left, secondary battery and [[anti-aircraft gun]]s to her right, and funnel behind the back. Base Rodney's rigging is colored standard Navy grey, but Kai adds blue camouflage coloring to the sides.

title: yotsuba_(kyokugen_dasshutsu)
body:
A character from [[Kyokugen Dasshutsu]], introduced in [[kyokugen dasshutsu: 9 jikan 9 nin 9 no tobira|9 Jikan 9 Nin 9 no Tobira]]. Known as "Clover" in English.

Has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] and [[aqua eyes]].

In 999, she wears a [[black jacket]] over a [[pink dress]], a [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[red skirt|red]] [[miniskirt]], [[fur leg warmers]], [[black boots|black]] [[high heel boots]], white [[earmuffs]] with a [[leopard print]], and a [[plaid bow|plaid]] [[red bow]].

In [[kyokugen dasshutsu adv: zennin shibou desu|Zennin Shibou Desu]], she has [[drill hair]] that is a lighter shade than in 999, as well as two [[pom pom hair ornament]]s. She wears a pink and black dotted [[fur trim|fur]] top that covers her [[cleavage]] with a [[black ribbon]] hanging down, two [[bracelet]]s on her right wrist, [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], a [[black belt]] with a [[clover]]-shaped [[buckle]], [[fur-trimmed legwear|fur-trimmed]] [[black leggings]] with [[black bow]]s, and [[purple high heels]] with [[pink bow]]s. She is often seen alongside [[Alice (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]] in this game.

[[Niels (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]] is her older brother.

title: shuna_no_tabi
body: Single volume full-color manga written by [[Miyazaki Hayao]] in 1983. Contains several similarities in characters, setting, and themes with [[Kaze no Tani no Nausicaa]], [[Mononoke Hime]], and [[Gedo Senki]]. It tells the story of a prince who travels in search of the Golden Wheat to save his people from starving. The English title has been rendered as "The Journey of Shuna"/"Shuna's Journey".

* A beige detective-style [[jacket]] that falls to about his hips, with a collar and visible front pockets.
* A red [[necktie]].
* Matching plaid cuffs on his wristsâ€”these match the material and color of his hat.
* Brown [[shoes]] with red patches on top of each foot, plus darker-brown sections along the soles.
* The same plaid pattern from his hat and cuffs is used around the shoe collars (almost like spats or folded-over cuffs).

title: slam_dunk_(series)
body:
A 1990-1996 [[basketball]] manga series by [[Inoue Takehiko]].

[[Sakuragi Hanamichi]] is a delinquent from Shohoku High School with an extremely unlucky love life. One day he meets and falls in love with basketball fan [[Akagi Haruko]], and to impress her, he joins their school's basketball team, captained by Haruko's hulking older brother Takenori, only to learn that he is better suited to the sport than he would ever admit.

The series was immensely popular, becoming the 7th best-selling manga of all time and single-handedly popularizing basketball in Japan.

title: sigma_(kyokugen_dasshutsu)
body:
A character from [[Kyokugen Dasshutsu]], first appearing as the protagonist of [[Kyokugen Dasshutsu adv: zennin shibou desu|Zennin Shibou Desu]]. He has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], [[grey eyes]], and a [[muscular]] build. Often seen alongside [[Phi (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]].

In Zennin Shibou Desu, he wears a [[blue shirt]] with numerous designs, including an [[anarchy symbol]], a [[grenade]], and a winged [[skull]], among others. He also wears [[blue pants]] and [[black shoes]].

[spoiler]Near the end of the game, it is revealed that his consciousness has been transported into the body of his [[aged up|future self]]. This version of Sigma is an [[old man]] with [[grey hair]] and a [[mechanical eye]].[/spoiler]

In [[zero escape: toki no dilemma|Toki no Dilemma]], he is a member of "D-Team" alongside Phi and [[Diana (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]]. He wears a [[black shirt|black]] [[polo shirt]], [[white pants|white]] [[khakis]], and [[black shoes]].

title: captain_titus
body:
The player character and protagonist of [[warhammer 40k: space marine|Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine I and II]], Captain (later Lieutenant) Demetrian Titus served as the commander of the [[Ultramarines]]' Second Company until the events of the first [i]Space Marine[/i] game saw him taken into the custody of the [[Inquisition]]. After being released following his captivity, Titus, assuming that his chapter had expunged his records given the circumstances of his detainment, would join the [[Deathwatch]] as a Blackshield. A botched mission against the [[tyranid|Tyranids]] would see him mortally wounded and turned into a Primaris Marine in order to survive. Afterwards, he would rejoin the Ultramarines (who had never forgotten him at all) with honors, though his absence would see him reinstated as a Lieutenant with Second Company having long been under new command.

He is known for his more lax attitude towards the [i]Codex Astartes[/i] and his high resistance to the effects of the Warp and Chaos, the later of which has seen suspicion repeatedly cast upon him.

title: mecha_pilot_suit
body:
A [[bodysuit]] worn by [[pilot]]s of [[mecha]], or a bodysuit associated with [[science fiction]] in general.

They typically have thicker material than a [[leotard]] (possibly similar to [[latex]]), one or more adornments or structures, parts/patches, and associated colors, lights, etc. Arm and leg covers may be anywhere from none to full.

This tag is for the fictional mecha pilot bodysuit; for the real life jumpsuit worn by pilots, uses [[flight suit]] instead.

h4. Related tags

title: degloving
body: Degloving occurs when skin and the fat below it, the subcutaneous tissue, are torn away from the underlying anatomical structures they are normally attached to.

title: bruise_on_knee
body: Knee injuries typical of falls, impacts, or friction against a hard surface. The knees are covered in bruises (hematomas), and the skin may be swollen with purple, blue, or yellowish patches due to damage to the subcutaneous blood vessels. There may also be superficial scrapes where the top layer of skin (epidermis) is worn away, sometimes with visible blood or serous fluid. The wounds can be contaminated with dirt or gravel, especially if the fall occurred on asphalt or rough ground.

title: roto's_emblem
body: [B]Roto's Emblem[/b], otherwise known as [b]Erdrick's Emblem[/b] in English localizations, is the symbol associated with the heroes in the [i][[Dragon Quest]][/i] series. The symbol is in the shape of a bird, likely an eagle, with either red dot or [[red gemstone]] in the middle. It is notably visible on [[Erdrick's Shield]] and the [[tabard]] of the [[Prince of Samantoria]].

title: dukemon
body:
Ultimate-level Holy Knight-type [[Digimon (creature)|]] that debuted in [[Digimon Tamers]] in 2001, and one of the thirteen Royal Knights of the Digital World. Dukemon is often depicted as the true final evolution of [[Guilmon]], contrasting the wicked [[Megidramon]]. Dukemon is a large knight-esque Digimon clad in [[white armor|white]] [[armor]] and a [[red cape|red]] [[cape]]. In its right hand, it wields the holy [[lance]] [i]Gram[/i], and its left hand carries the holy [[shield]] [i]Aegis[/i]. Its offensive and defensive prowess is said to be unrivaled even among the Royal Knights, and it possesses the titles of "Crimson Knight" and "Sky-Conquering Armored Lancer", the latter making reference to its armored flying platform [[Grani (digimon)|ZERO-ARMS: Grani]].

In a number of narratives, including [[Digital Monster X-Evolution|Digimon X-Evolution]] and [[Digimon World Re:Digitize Decode]], Dukemon stands in opposition with its fellow Royal Knight [[Omegamon]]. The Royal Knight depicted here is noted to value potential in lifeforms.

Dukemon is referred to as [b]Gallantmon[/b] in international material.

[u]Common evolutionary throughline:[/u]
[[Jyarimon]] -> [[Gigimon]] -> [[Guilmon]] -> [[Growmon]] -> [[Megalogrowmon|Megalo Growmon]] -> [[Megidramon]] / [b]Dukemon[/b]
* Dukemon can evolve further with the [[Dukemon X-Antibody|X-Antibody]].
* By using the power of ZERO-ARMS: Grani, Dukemon will evolve to [[Dukemon Crimson Mode]].
* Dukemon has a sinister counterpart in [[Chaosdukemon|Chaos Dukemon]], which has embraced its potential as the Digital Hazard.

title: olivia_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[dark_angel_olivia|Dark Angel Olivia]] in her summer outfit. Released July 31st, 2018.

In hopes of reviving her brethren, the fallen archangel of dusk studies the ways of those who inhabit the Sky Realm. During the hottest month, a child of man teaches her about cherished summer customs. Despite her perceptive nature, she has yet to notice these new experiences broadening her horizons and opening her heart.

title: leaning_forward
body:

This pose is often seen when [[undressing]] or to present [[cleavage]] or show [[downblouse]].

title: punishing:_gray_raven
body:
Chinese 3D action RPG based on the Unity3D engine, a second production of the "Twintails in Battlefield" (â€œæˆ˜åœºåŒé©¬å°¾/æˆ˜åŒâ€) franchise by [[Kuro Games]], Guangzhou.

Punishing: Gray Raven (PGR) is set in a post-apocalyptic world ravaged by the Punishing Virus, a biomechanical virus that corrupts all forms of mechanical constructs and robotics. The player is the Commandant of an elite task force of cyborg Constructs known as Gray Raven, in service to the space station Babylonia, the main resistance front against the Punishing Virus.

PGR has had two previous collaborations with other games/IPs, the collaboration event 'Untold Naraka' with [[NieR:Automata]] during January 2021 (CN) and July 2022 (Global), and the event 'Blazing Simulacrum' with [[Black Rock Shooter]] during August 2023 (CN), though the BRS collaboration is yet to be released on to the global server.

h4. See also

title: on_car
body:
[[Riding]], [[sitting]], [[standing]] or [[lying|resting]] on a [[car]]. The car may be still or being driven. This tag should not be used if the character is sitting inside the car. Sitting on a [[convertible]]'s seat does not count either, unless there is another person sitting on the vehicle besides the seat. If the character's body passes through a [[car]]'s [[sunroof]], use [[through sunroof]] instead.

title: through_window
body:
When a character's body is passing or leaning halfway through a window frame - possibly to reach something, or to escape an area.

* !post #7666042

Do not use when the character smashes through a window, use [[breaking through window]] instead.

If the character is leaning on the window, use [[leaning out of window]].

Not to be confused with, though they're not mutually exclusive:
* [[from outside]], a viewpoint from outside through a window.
* [[looking outside]], character is looking through a window.

h4. See also
* [[against glass]]
* [[defenestration]]
* [[sitting in window]]
* [[through screen]]
* [[through sunroof]]

title: sunroof
body:
A sunroof is a glass panel/window on the roof of a [[car]].  The panel may be movable or stationary.

h4. See also

* [[Skylight]]
* [[Through sunroof]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Sunroof":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunroof]

title: captured
body:
When someone is being held in custody by others, often while being [[restrained]].

Not to be confused with [[caught]], which refers when someone is found committing something embarrassing.

h4. See also
* [[Cage]]
* [[Handcuffs]]
* [[Prison]]
** [[Prison cell]]

title: sponge_cake
body:
A light and soft baked dessert, commonly layered with cream and jam, usually made with flour, sugar, baking powder and eggs, with a firm yet well aerated structure, similar to a sea sponge.

h4. See also

* [[Angel food cake]]
* [[Chiffon cake]]

title: cancer_death_mask
body:
[[Gold Saint]] of the Cancer constellation in the original [[Saint Seiya]] anime and manga series.

A treacherous, unscrupulous and cowardly Saint. He sides with the evil Pope during the battle of Sanctuary despite knowing he wished to kill and usurp [[athena_(saint_seiya)|Athena]]. He believes it's only logical that he sides with whoever provides him with the most benefits.

His real name is unknown; Deathmask is a nickname he received from his peers due to the way he adorns the Cancer Temple with the faces of his many victims, children included. In the English localisation,  his name was changed to Cancer Mephisto.

In the original manga, he has [[short_hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and [[red eyes]]. His anime design gives him [[purple hair|violet hair]] and   [[purple eyes|eyes]].

body:

* Spit cakes: Cakes made by layering batter over a rotating spit
** [[Baumkuchen]]

title: aquarius_camus
body:
[[Gold Saint]] of the Aquarius constellation in the original [[Saint Seiya]] anime and manga series.

Known as "the Mage of Water and Ice". He is the master of [[Cygnus Hyouga]] in the original manga and trained him in the icy tundras of Eastern Siberia. However, in the anime, he bears no personal relation to Hyoga and instead trained the anime-original character, the Crystal Saint, who is Hyoga's master in the anime.

In the original manga, he has [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]], [[red eyes]] and [[red nails|red fingernails]]. In the anime adaptation, his [[blue hair|hair]] and [[blue eyes|eyes]] were made blue and he lacks any [[nail polish]].

title: kazama_iroha
body:
A [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] from [[hololive]]'s 6th generation "[[holoX]]". A [[samurai]] from a distant land who joined the holoX secret organization and served as a hitman and bodyguard. Designed by [[Umibouzu (niito)|]].

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium]]/[[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[small breasts]], although more often than not fanart exaggerates her bust size, giving her [[medium breasts]] (at the very least).

Her default hairstyle with her default outfit is a [[ponytail]] held with a [[multicolored bow|multicolored]] [[hair bow]], an [[ahoge]] and [[double-parted bangs]] held with a [[black hairband]].

More formally [b]Laplus Dia Highest Death Thirteen Daina Art of Impact Sign Emperor Road of the Darknesss[/b].

Note: The triple [i]s[/i] in [i]Darknesss[/i] is not a typo.

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[grey hair]] with a [[purple hair|purple]] [[streaked hair|streak]], [[double-parted_bangs|double-parted]] [[braided bangs]], and an [[ahoge]], as well as [[pointy ears]] and [[yellow eyes]] with [[slit pupils]], [[black_horns|black]] [[striped_horns|striped]] [[demon horns]] and a [[tail]] made of several star-shaped segments.

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[pink hair]], [[purple eyes]], [[wolf ears|coyote ears]], [[wolf tail|tail]], and [[large breasts]].
Her regular hairstyle consists of a [[crown braid]] that turns into [[double bun|double]] [[braided bun]]s with [[sidelocks]], [[choppy bangs|choppy]] [[double-parted bangs]] and [[antenna hair]], she also has a pair of [[hexagon hair ornament]]s styled after a chemical diagram.

title: takane_lui
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] from [[hololive]]'s 6th generation "holoX". Designed by [[Kakage]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair]] with [[pink wings|same-colored]] [[head wings]], [[blue eyes]] (which she can turn [[orange eyes|orange]] with [[crosshair pupils]]), and [[large breasts]]. She also has [[long legs]] and [[wide hips]] with a noticeable [[thigh gap]] which gives her a very particular silhouette that some fans compare to a tuning fork.
Her default hairstyle is [[short hair|short]] [[parted hair]] held with a [[black hairband]] and [[double-parted bangs]] reaching [[hair_between_eyes|between her eyes]].

Artists sometimes depict her as a [[Takane Lui (hawk)|hawk]] (especially in HOLOTORI group arts), and a bald eagle.

She is sometimes seen accompanied by her partner/caretaker, [[Ganmo (takane lui)|]] the [[frogmouth]], and two younglings: a smaller chick with one feather-ahoge named [[Tsumire (takane lui)|]], and a slightly larger chick with three feather-ahoges named [[Tsukune (takane lui)|]].
