title: takane_lui_(new_year)
body:
The 2nd/New Years [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Takane Lui]].

It consists of a [[mini hat|small]] [[black headwear|black]] [[trilby]] with a [[plume]], a [[blue kimono|dark blue]]/[[black kimono|black]] [[vertical-striped kimono|vertical-striped]] [[lace-trimmed kimono]] with a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] underneath, a [[white scarf|white]] [[fur scarf]], a black [[obi]] with a [[red sash]] tied into a [[waist bow]], [[white socks]], [[brown boots]], she also has a [[single earring|single]] [[star earrings|star earring]] on her left ear.

She has 2 [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:
* [[Long hair|Long]] [[pink hair]] done in a [[drill ponytail]] going [[hair over shoulder|over her shoulder]]
* [[Very long hair|Very long]] [[parted hair]] decorated with a [[black hairband]], a [[white flower|white]] [[hair flower]] and a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25444912: Profile

title: takane_lui_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive]]'s [[Takane Lui]].

It consists of a [[black choker]], a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] with [[breast zipper]]s, a [[red necktie]] with a [[white ascot]] under it, an [[underbust]] [[chest harness]], [[sleeve garter]]s, [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[black gloves]], [[black shorts|black]] [[high-waist shorts|high-waist]] [[leather shorts]], a [[black pantyhose]], a [[thigh strap]] with a [[whip]] hanging from it on her right leg, and [[black shoes|black]] [[strappy heels]] (although they are sometimes depicted in fanart as [[pumps]] with [[ankle cuffs]]). She also has an optional [[red coat|red]] [[feather-trimmed coat]] which she wears [[coat on shoulders|on her shoulders]] and a [[orange-tinted eyewear|orange-tinted]] [[sunglasses]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25444908: Profile

* !post #8203010: Merchandise (with coat)
* !post #8302623: Merchandise (without coat)

title: power_armor
body:
[b]Power Armor[/b] is a term commonly used to describe full-body armor that not only protects, but enhances physical capabilities. Unlike regular body [[armor]], this includes some form of powered [[exoskeleton]] or [[power suit]] to act as mechanical muscle, reducing the user's amount of work to do just about anything. A common form of armor in [[science fiction]] and [[tokusatsu]], especially in [[space]] environments - a popular example is [[Samus Aran]].

One of the first appearances of power armor in science fiction was in the novel [[Starship Troopers]] (1959).

h1. Notable Power Armor Characters & Copyrights
* [[Iron Man]] ([[Marvel]])
* [[Master Chief]] ([[Halo (series)|]])
* [[marine_(starcraft)|Terran Marine]] ([[StarCraft]])
* [[Samus Aran]] ([[Metroid]])
* [[Doomguy]] ([[Doom i]])
* [[Pharah (overwatch)|]] ([[Overwatch]])
* [[Fallout]] series
* [[Bubblegum Crisis]]
* [[Warhammer 40K]]
* Certain [[Kamen Rider]] series
* [[Mospeada (mecha)]]/[[Mospeada]]
* [[Queadluun-Rau]]/[[MACROSS]]

body:

title: hattori_shizuka
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches]]. She was introduced in the movie, and she would later become a main cast member and member of the [[501st Joint Fighter Wing]] in the third season.

A Sergeant from the Fuso Imperial Navy who worships [[Miyafuji Yoshika]].

Her weapon is a Type 99-2 cannon. Her familiar is a Shikoku dog, and she's based on Utou Kazushi.

title: samus_aran
body:
The main protagonist of the [[Metroid]] series. A Bounty Hunter that has averted countless crises that have threatened the galaxy, such as those involving the [[Metroid (creature)|]]s, [[Phazon]] and the [[X Parasite]]s.

Adopted by the [[Chozo]] after being orphaned by a [[Space Pirate (metroid)|]] raid, she was infused with their [[alien]] DNA and raised as a warrior. She later served under Commanding Officer [[Adam Malkovich]] within the Galactic Federation Army, but after a traumatic incident she left to become an independent Bounty Hunter.

She is armed with a Chozo [[power suit|cybernetic exoskeleton]] equipped with an [[Arm Cannon]] and a [[assault_visor|visor]] known as the [[power_suit_(metroid)|Power Suit]] that protects her and greatly enhances her abilities. This suit also has the means to assimilate other technology within itself to [[power-up|upgrade]] it's capabilities and gain greater power. She wears the [[Zero Suit]] under it in case of a malfunction which offers far less protection and only has her armed with the [[Paralyzer]].

According to the [[metroid_2:_return_of_samus|Metroid II]] manual and concept art for [[Super Metroid]] within her power suit she is 6'3" (1.90 m) [tn]"[1]":[http://metroid.retropixel.net/gallery.php?gallery_id=m2_manual&image_id=8][/tn][tn]"[2]":[https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/metroid/images/c/c1/M3_Kraid_design.png/][/tn].

body:

title: the_lord_of_the_rings
body:
An epic high [[fantasy]] novel written by J. R. R. Tolkien, sequel to [[The Hobbit]] and [[The Silmarillion]]. Received a trilogy movie adaptation directed by Peter Jackson between 2001 - 2003, which was considered to be one of the best movie trilogies ever made.

[i]The Lord of the Rings[/i] is also one of the most influential fantasy fictional works, as several elements from the novel (and movies to an extent) such as characteristics of the [[orc]]s and [[elf|elves]] were later adapted into other subsequent fantasy media.

title: genderswap
body:
A "genderswap" refers to the almost magical version of a sex change, wherein a character of one sex turns into one of the other sex without any medical involvement. 

This tag can also apply to an image of a character of one sex depicted as one of the opposite sex (e.g. a male version of a female character or vice versa). May also apply to male-to-[[futanari]], but since futanari is not wholly female, female-to-futanari may also qualify. A being with no sex depicted as any of these may technically count.

This tag can also be applied to an [[otoko no ko]] if the character is given female traits such as the presence of actual [[cleavage]] or the obvious absence of a [[bulge]] at the crotch. For [[reverse trap]]s, the absence of cleavage or presence of a bulge applies.

If a character is genderswapped often enough, the genderswapped version may be given its own name. For male-to-female genderswaps, this is often the normal character's name with "ko" appended to it. (å­ "Ko" meaning "child" is a common ending for Japanese girls' names.) For female-to-male genderswaps, "o" is sometimes added. 

Known in Internet circles as Rule 63, wherein there is a female or male version of any given male or female character, respectively.

[b]Notes:[/b] 
* If the person has only swapped bodies with another from the opposite sex, but the body itself has not changed, then use [[personality switch]] instead.
* The "å¥³ä½“åŒ–" tag may also on occasion be used to describe female [[personification]], rather than a genderswap.
* If a character in canon is genderswapped but rarely shown in their original form (such as [[Mai Natsume]] or [[Tanya Degurechaff]]), the tag only applies if said original form is included or somehow alluded to.
* For posts depicting a character undergoing the process of gender transition, use the tag [[gender transitioning]].

h4. See also

* [[Genderswap (FTM)]]
* [[Genderswap (MTF)]]
* [[Genderswap (OTF)]]
* [[Genderswap (OTM)]]
* [[Midnight Bliss]]
* [[List of Genderswap Characters]]
* [[Tag group:Artistic license]]

title: the_one_ring
body:
A magical [[ring]] that appears in [[The Hobbit]] and becomes the central plot element in [[The Lord of the Rings]].
Also known as [[Sauron]]'s Ring, the Ruling Ring, [[Isildur]]'s Bane, and the Precious.
When cold it has the appearance of a perfectly smooth, unadorned [[gold ring]], but when hot it has a glowing inscription in [[Tengwar]] [[Black Speech]].

title: gold_cloth
body:
The highest rank of Cloth in [[Saint Seiya]] adorning the [[gold_saint|Gold Saints]].

As their name suggests, they are [[gold armor|golden sets of armor]] that provide the most coverage compared to their Bronze and Silver counterparts.
They number 12 in total, each is based on one of the twelve zodiac constellations.

In [[saint_seiya:_next_dimension|Next Dimension]]; [Spoiler]it is revealed there was a 13th gold cloth during the age of myth, based on the Ophiuchus constellation.

title: sensha_otoko
body:
Type-Moon Official April Fool's Joke for April 2009, Sensha Otoko (Tank Man, a parody of the popular "true story" love comedy, [[Densha Otoko]] (Train Man)). The characters are mostly from Fate/Zero, with a few appearances from Fate/Stay Night characters. 

This is a story about 212cm military otaku with "Sensha Otoko" as his handle name, who despite his huge, imposing appearance, is actually very shy, and thus no girlfriends. One day, he saves a teenage girl from being harassed, and falls in love. However, because he has no experience in romance, he consults his [[otaku]] friends on the web-board Eirei Throne-Channel for advice. This is the beginning of a True Tank Story.

h4. Character 

h6. Main Characters

* [[iskandar (sensha otoko) (fate)|"Sensha Otoko"]] - Protagonist. ([[Iskandar (fate)|]])
* [[waver velvet (sensha otoko)|"El-Melloi Girl"]] - Heroine. ([[Waver Velvet]])

h6. Sensha Otoko's Friends From Eirei Throne Channel

* [[medea (sensha otoko) (fate)|"Medea"]] - a former model betrayed by her boyfriend. ([[Medea (caster) (fate)|]])
* [[gilgamesh (sensha otoko) (fate)|"Gil"]] - a cool hikikomori stalker. ([[Gilgamesh (fate)|]])
* [[berserker (sensha otoko) (fate)|"U to O"]] - a helmet-wearing man who fears facial exposure and eye-contact. ([[Berserker (Fate/Zero)]])
* "Danna" - Criminal No. 1. ([[Gilles de rais (caster) (fate)|]])
* "Ryuu-chan" - Criminal No. 2. ([[Uryuu Ryuunosuke]])
* "Godbull" - an intelligent fighter bull who knows how to access the internet.

h6. El-Melloi Family

* Papa - a man who loves his wife above all else, and despises his son. ([[Kayneth El-Melloi Archibald]])
* Mama - a woman who loves her eldest son above all else. ([[Sola-Ui Nuada-Re Sophia-Ri]])
* [[diarmuid ua duibhne (sensha otoko) (fate)|Onii-chan]] - an older brother who loves his younger sister above all else. ([[Diarmuid ua duibhne (lancer) (fate)|]])

h6. Supporting Cast

* [[sasaki kojirou (sensha otoko) (fate)|Sasaki]] - Medea's friendzoned male caretaker. ([[Sasaki kojirou (fate)|]])
* [[enkidu (sensha otoko) (fate)|"Enkidu-chan"]] - "Gil's" childhood friend and next door neighbor, a girl who loves her dog. ([[Enkidu (fate)|]])
* Matsuken - a mysterious, wise English teacher. 
* [[Kotomine Kirei (sensha otoko)|]] - The Tohsaka family's housekeeper, and "Gil's" caretaker.

h4. External links

* "Official Site":http://tatari.byethost33.com/tmfools/09/sensya/intro.htm
* "Type-Moon 2009 April Fools Site":http://tatari.byethost33.com/tmfools/09/index.htm

title: m'aiq
body:
[i]"M'aiq knows much, tells some. M'aiq knows many things others do not."[/i]

Better known as M'aiq the Liar, a recurring [[khajiit]] male character of [[The Elder Scrolls]] franchise. Initially an obscure NPC in [[the_elder_scrolls_iii:_morrowind|Morrowind]] who, true to his name, gave a litany of false advice, save for an in-game location. Since then, his role has evolved to being an in-game mouthpiece for the developers to poke fun at themselves and the fanbase.

title: dovahkiin
body:
The customizable protagonist of [[The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim]], also known as the Dragonborn.

While customizable by the player, promotional media show them with a distinct "Iron Helmet":[http://elderscrolls.wikia.com/wiki/Iron_Helmet_%28Skyrim%29].

h4. External links

* "Elder Scrolls Wiki: Last Dragonborn":https://elderscrolls.fandom.com/wiki/Last_Dragonborn

title: lydia_(skyrim)
body: A character and companion in [[The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim]]. By default, she is a nord woman with [[brown hair|brown]] [[short hair]] with a [[braid]] to the side of it. She is a housecarl who becomes available for the player character to freely hire after completing an early story quest. Despite other followers being obtainable before her availability and her dialogue being shared with any other with the same voice type, her early game attainability, combat viability, and unique sass towards the player has made her memorable among the community.

title: odahviing
body:
Odahviing is a dragon and was an ally of and right-hand dragon to Alduin. The Dragonborn must summon him to an encounter in Whiterun during the main quest. At which point he is captured and bargains for his freedom, swearing his loyalty to the Dragonborn, and taking them too where they can find and confront Alduin.

In the dragon language his name is spelled using the words for Snow/OD, Hunter/AH, and Wing/VIING but some write it as (Winged Snow Hunter).

At some point during the story Odahviing and other dragons loyal to Alduin began to have doubts about Alduin's rule, likely out of fear of losing another war. Which was likely the catalyst to him betraying Alduin to the Dragonborn. After Alduin defeat, he chooses to go his own way and embrace his newfound freedom while swearing his loyalty to the Dragonborn. He does however refuse to restrain himself in the same way as Paarthurnax does, calling his "way of the voice" a form of tyranny.

title: paarthurnax
body:
Paarthurnax is a dragon also called "the Old One" by other dragons, is the leader of the Greybeards. He served as Alduin's lieutenant during the Dragon War, during which he was said to have committed and witnessed unspeakable atrocities against mankind. However, his brother Alduin's claim to godhood caused him to rebel against him, siding with the humans by teaching them how to use the Thu'um.

In the Dragon language his name is spelled using the words for Ambition/PAAR, Overlord/THUR, and Cruelty/NAX

As with all Dragons, the lust for power was innate and still strong within him and if left unchecked, he would surely revert to his old ways. To overcome this, he retired to the peak of the Throat of the World and lived in seclusion so that he could meditate and focus. Although he played a big part in Alduin's eventual defeat, he was not happy about it, as he still considered him his brother and would mourn his passing.

title: alduin
body:
Alduin, aslo known as the World Eater also considered an alternative name of Akatosh (patron god of dragons and time) by some of Tamriel is a dragon and the primary antagonist of [[The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim]]'s Main Quest. He is considered the "wellspring" of the Nordic pantheon, as well as the harbinger of the apocalypse. He is also described as the "creator of dragon civilization" in one particular text.

In the Dragon Language his name is spelled using the words for Destroyer/AL, Devour/DU, and Master/IN. 

Many dragons refer to Alduin as "the first" while a few even call him Brother. Alduin himself as even called them his children, however the actual familial connection is up for debate.

body:
[b]The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim[/b] is an open world action role-playing video game developed by Bethesda Game Studios. It is the fifth main installment in [[The Elder Scrolls]] series, following [[The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion]], and was released worldwide for Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 on November 11, 2011.

She is a [[dark-skinned female|dark-skinned]] woman with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Often seen alongside [[Yotsuba (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]].

Wears a beige [[jacket]] that shows her [[midriff]], a [[black skirt]], and gold [[high heel sandals]]. She also has a golden [[bracelet]] and [[necklace]], [[blue eyeshadow]], and [[blue nails]].

title: twitch_(shantae)
body:
One of the few female soldiers in [[Ammo Baron]]'s army. 

Has [[blonde hair]], wears a [[white tank top]], [[blue skirt]], [[yellow gloves|yellow]] & [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]] and a [[backpack]]. She wears [[green-tinted eyewear| green]] [[goggles]] and has a [[thigh holster]] for a comically oversized [[gun]]. Like the rest of the army she has a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[helmet]] that feature animalistic tails and ears, with the front of his featuring a [[:3]] face.

Always seen with [[Vinegar (shantae)|]]. Was a prototype design for [[Sky (shantae)|]] [tn]"[1]":[https://web.archive.org/web/20170908000516/https://www.themarysue.com/interview-with-shantae-co-creator-matt-bozon/][/tn].

title: delta_(kyokugen_dasshutsu)
body:
A character from [[Kyokugen Dasshutsu]], introduced in [[Zero Escape: Toki no Dilemma]]. An [[old man]] with [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and [[purple eyes]] with [[black sclera]]e. Wears a [[blue sweater|blue]] [[turtleneck sweater]] with [[long sleeves]], [[brown pants]], [[blue shoes]], and [[opaque glasses|opaque]] [[sunglasses]] with [[red-tinted eyewear|red lenses]] and a [[yellow-framed eyewear|yellow frame]].

[spoiler]The true identity of Zero II, the main antagonist of the game and the overarching antagonist of the entire series. Also known as [[Q (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]].[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance
* !asset #25438499

h4. External links
* "Zero Escape Wiki":[https://zeroescape.fandom.com/wiki/Delta]

title: q_(kyokugen_dasshutsu)
body:
A character introduced in [[Zero Escape: Toki no Dilemma]]. A member of â€œQ-Teamâ€ alongside [[Eric (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]] and [[Mira (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]]. He is a young boy with a large, round [[helmet]] covering his whole head. The helmet is [[rust|rusted]], and has a large [[crack]] that vaguely resembles a mouth.

Wears a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] with purple [[striped shirt|stripes]], [[grey overalls]], [[kneehighs|knee-high]] [[blue socks]], and [[brown shoes]]. He also has a [[bandaid on knee|bandaid on his left knee]].

[spoiler]The player is misled to believe his name is Q, which in reality is an alias used by [[Delta (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]]. His true identity is Sean, an [[android]] created by Delta. What looks like a helmet is actually his head.[/spoiler]

title: gamecenter_cx
body:
A long-running program on [[Fuji Television]], starring Yoiko member [[Arino Shin'ya]] as the section chief of fictional company Game Center CX. 

While the earliest seasons focused on Arino interviewing different game companies and learning about the backgrounds of their various works, this was later dropped. The series is well known for its "Arino's Challenge" (æœ‰é‡ã®æŒ‘æˆ¦çŠ¶, [i]Arino no Chousenjou[/i]) segments, where Arino plays through and attempts to complete retro games with the help of his Assistant Directors and various other staff members. It was briefly brought over to the West in the late 2000's as [i]Retro Game Master[/i]. [[Nintendo]] eventually released a parody of the series in 2015 on its Youtube page titled [i]Gamecenter DX[/i], which has Arino's co-star Hamaguchi Masaru as a manager playing games that haven't been released.

In 2007, the series had a [[Nintendo DS]] game modeled after it: [i][[Gamecenter CX: Arino's Challenge]][/i], with a lot of the game's input coming directly from the show's staff. The game then got a sequel in 2009 and a [[Nintendo 3DS]] sequel in 2014.

h4. External links

title: fujiwara_no_mokou
body:
The "Crimson Watchguard". Extra Stage boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Imperishable Night]][/i].

An immortal human with powers of [[fire|pyromancy]]. Mokou bears a deep grudge against [[Houraisan Kaguya|Kaguya]] for spurning her father's hand in marriage when the former was still young (humiliating him in the process), which caused her to steal and drink the Hourai Elixir as revenge. Upon reaching Gensokyo, she learned that Kaguya, too, was an immortal exile, and both have since engaged in countless fatal duels for fun.

When not picking a fight with Kaguya, she rescues lost people or guides them through the Bamboo Forest to Eientei, home of her own nemesis, or the Human Village, where her friend [[Kamishirasawa Keine]] lives, and claims to run a yakitori stand (which would put her at odds with [[Mystia Lorelei]]).

Became playable in [[Urban Legend in Limbo]] and [[Antinomy of Common Flowers]].

h4. See also

* [[Fujiwara no Mokou (young)|Young Mokou]]
* [[Fujiwara no Mokou (phoenix)|Phoenix Mokou]]
* "Emoting Mokou":[/pools/11667]

h4. External links

* "Touhou wiki: Fujiwara no Mokou":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Fujiwara_no_Mokou

title: houraisan_kaguya
body:
The "Eternal Lunar Princess". Final boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Imperishable Night]], imbued with the power of immortality.

The former princess of the Lunarians, banished to Earth for drinking the Hourai Elixir, which gave her immortality. She has since settled in Eientei, a mansion deep within a bamboo forest in [[Gensokyo]], where she came to love the humans she once detested and her new, easygoing life. Because of this, she is comically depicted in fanon as a [[NEET]] who is always dependent on her bodyguard and creator of the Hourai Elixir, [[Yagokoro Eirin]]. She is also the master of lunar rabbit [[Reisen Udongein Inaba]].

She shares a bitter rivalry with [[Fujiwara no Mokou]], daughter of one of her many spurned suitors. Both have since been killing each other for centuries, despite knowing that neither can permanently die.

h4. See also

* [[Kaguya Day]] (8th September)
* [[Kaguya Hime]] - the character from the folktale.
* [[Tasukete Eirin]] - a joke on her dependence on Eirin

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Kaguya Houraisan":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Kaguya_Houraisan
* "Wikipedia: The Tale of the Bamboo Cutter":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Tale_of_the_Bamboo_Cutter - the ancient Japanese folktale upon which Kaguya's character is based.

title: mizukawa_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by students of Mizukawa Girls' School, seen mainly in [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]. 

It consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[dress shirt]], a colored [[necktie]], a [[black sweater vest|black]] [[sweater vest]], an [[black jacket|black]] [[blazer]] with an [[emblem]] on the wearer's left, and a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]]. 

As [[Wien Margarete]] ([[Love Live! Superstar!!]]) wears a similar uniform, this may be used for her appearance in her middle school uniform as well.

title: cake_stand
body:
A tall, pedestal-like plate used for displaying [[cake|cakes]], especially in a shop's window or for weddings. See post #3238614 for an example. Some cake stands have a glass dome for protecting the cake.

Be careful not to confuse this tag with [[tiered tray]]. A cake stand only has one level.

title: nintendo_switch_2
body:
Nintendo's upcoming video [[game console]], successor to [[Nintendo Switch]].

It was revealed on January 16, 2025, and is set to be released June 5, 2025. 

Its [[Joy-Con 2]]s have a protrusion for clipping into the sides of the main body magnetically, rather than sliding onto the sides from the top like the original Switch.

h4. External links

* "Official webpage":[https://www.nintendo.com/successor/]

title: cake
body:
A baked [[dessert]] made from a dough or thick batter usually containing flour and sugar and often shortening, eggs, and a raising agent.  They're often covered in either [[icing]] or frosting and decorated with embroidery, figures, flowers, or other toppings.

Cakes are frequently the dessert of choice used for ceremonial occasions, such as [[birthday|birthdays]] and [[wedding|weddings]].

Cake is a significant element in the [[Portal (series)|]] series.

title: eustass_kid
body:
[[One Piece]] character. One of the [[Eleven Supernova]] and captain of the Kid Pirates. He is a rival of the fellow Supernovas [[Monkey D. Luffy]] and [[Trafalgar Law]]. During the timeskip, he challenged the Emperor [[Shanks (one piece)|]] and ended up losing his left arm after the battle with his first mate [[Benn Beckman]].

Having consumed the Jiki Jiki no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], he has powers over magnetism, allows him to attract or repel metallic objects as he please. After the timeskip, he use this power to attach his [[prosthetic arm]] on him, which also doubles as a [[railgun]].

Please use [[monster]] or [[creature]] for fictional or mythical animals, such as [[griffin]]s, [[cabbit]]s, or [[jackalope]]s.

If the animal to be tagged is sizably larger than the other subjects, use [[oversized animal]]. Be sure to identify the correct [[size difference]], since it might be the [[miniboy|other]] way [[minigirl|around]].

title: monochrome
body:
An image drawn in predominantly one color. It doesn't have to be just black and white; it could be another color such as [[red theme|red]], [[blue theme|blue]], [[green theme|green]], etc.

If the image uses more than just black and white and uses more shades of grey, also tag with [[greyscale]]. For non-[[greyscale]] monochrome pictures, add the appropriate color tag, such as [[red theme]], [[blue theme]], [[green theme]] etc.

[[Monochrome]] and [[partially colored]] are mutually exclusive. For monochrome pictures with just a bit of color, use [[monochrome]] and [[spot color]] together. If the image has a range of colors but appears grayed out or washed out, see [[muted color]] and [[pale color]].

[[Comic]]s and [[doujinshi]] are often monochrome.

title: greyscale
body:
A completely colorless, black-and-white image. The image is composed exclusively of shades of black, white, and grey. It is very common for [[comic]]s and [[doujinshi]] to be in greyscale.

The image may have small highlights of color (known as [[spot color]]s), but the image as a whole should be predominately greyscale.

Don't use color tags like [[black eyes]] or [[black hair]] when tagging greyscale images. The exception is color background tags, so tagging [[white background]], [[grey background]], or [[black background]] is fine.

h4. Guidelines

* For completely colorless art, use [[greyscale]].
* For a post consisting of a single color that isn't grey, use [[monochrome]], not [[greyscale]].
* For a mostly greyscale post with a small amount of color as a highlight, use [[greyscale]] and [[spot color]].
* For a post using a mix of color and greyscale, use [[partially colored]], not [[greyscale]].
* For a colorless foreground and colorful background, use [[greyscale with colored background]], not [[greyscale]] or [[partially colored]].
* For a post that has solid black shadings, use [[greyscale]] and [[high contrast]].
* For posts with a small variety of colors but more than two actual colors, use [[limited palette]], not [[greyscale]] or [[monochrome]].

h4. Examples

* !post #5785450
* !post #5591560: [[Spot color]]

h4. Not greyscale

* !post #5653986: [[Monochrome]]
* !post #5761420: [[Sepia]]
* !post #5782023: [[Partially colored]]
* !post #6764762: [[Limited palette]]
* !post #3408688: [[Muted color]]

h4. See also

* [[greyscale with colored background]]
* [[high contrast]]
* [[lineart]]
* [[monochrome]]
* [[muted color]]
* [[partially colored]]
* [[sepia]]
* [[spot color]]
* [[Tag Group:Colors]]

title: real_life
body:
An illustration of a non-fictional character, or a famous person from real life, such as a celebrity, politician, athlete, musician, [[voice actor]], historical figure, or other public figure. 

Do not use for things that aren't illustrations of notable people from real life. This includes mythical figures, photos of random people, drawings of historical events or subjects, drawings of [[real world location]]s, and drawings of real world ships, planes, or cars. The purpose of this tag is to be the copyright tag for "characters" who are real people from real life, rather than fictional or [[original]] characters. If it's an illustration of an ordinary person, like the artist's friend or a stranger, use [[original]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[real life insert]]
* [[tag group:people]]
* [[list of real life animals]]

title: uss_iowa_(ssn-797)
body:
A Block-IV [i]Virginia[/i]-class nuclear [[submarine]] of the [[United States Navy]] and the fourth vessel to carry the name of the Hawkeye State. First announced in 2015, construction began in 2019 and was completed in 2024. It was officially commissioned into U.S. Military service on April 5, 2025.

title: flycatcher_(animal)
body:
A family of [[bird]]s. These family includes any bird that catches flying insects midair. 

There are more than 400 species of them found between Alaska and the southern tip of South America, however, most of them are small birds with a short peak.

title: blue-and-white_flycatcher
body:
Latin: [i]Cyanoptila cyanomelana[/i]
JP: ã‚ªã‚ªãƒ«ãƒª [i]ooruri[/i]

Adult male has royal blue upperparts, white belly, and black face, throat, and breast. (The immature male has blue wings and brown body, and the female is brown.)

Breeds in Japan and other areas of eastern Asia. 

Very similar visually to the [[bluebird]]. Look for a black face and throat, and white belly.

title: kingdom_hearts_missing-link
body:
The fifteenth installment in the [[Kingdom Hearts]] series.

It was officially announced alongside [[Kingdom Hearts IV]] on April 10, 2022 during the franchise's 20th anniversary.

It is a mobile game originally scheduled to be released in 2024, but has been postponed indefinitely.

The story takes place in the time period between [[Kingdom Hearts X]] and [[Kingdom Hearts Dark Road]].

title: hornet_ii_(azur_lane)
body: The personification of the [i]Essex[/i]-class carrier [i][[USS Hornet (CV-12)|Hornet]][/i] in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. Not to be confused with [[Hornet (Azur Lane)|her namesake predecessor, CV-8]], although it is specified that Hornet II has the body and memories of the original Hornet but with Essex-class equipment and abilities. Character design by [[Kurumi (recycllamo)|]], voiced by Yamamoto Nozomi. In her [i]Essex[/i]-class form, she retains virtually all of her [i]Yorktown[/i]-class dress attributes but with some updates. She is still portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] tied into a pair of [[twintails]] and [[green eyes]]. Her attire still consists of a [[black bikini|black]] [[bikini top only|bikini top]], a pair of [[short shorts]], and [[black thighhighs]], though she now gains [[thigh strap]]s above the thighhighs. She sports a pair of black [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]] that stop right before the knuckle and have a yellow stripe along their length, as well as a dashing [[cowboy hat]], with a [[yellow belt]] and underside. Her [[black coat]] loses the number 8, however. Her [[rigging]] is now the same as the [i]Essex[/i]-class: a split [[flight deck]], one half on each side. h4. title: yabi_fashion
body:
Yabi is a Chinese youth subculture associated with the underground music scene that arose in the late 2010s, borrowing heavily from [[Y2K fashion]] and [[streetwear]]. Yabi literally means "subculture cunt" or "subculture bitch", and is a rebellious movement emphasizing personal expression.

It has an eclectic and maximalist appearance, blending elements of many existing styles.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Fashion style]]

h4. External links

* "Aesthetics Wiki: Yabi":https://aesthetics.fandom.com/wiki/Yabi
* "A Quick, Dirty Guide to Chinaâ€™s Controversial New Subculture - The Yabi":https://radii.co/article/chinas-controversial-latest-subculture-yabi
* "The Involution of Freedom in Yabi Subculture":https://madeinchinajournal.com/2024/08/06/the-involution-of-freedom-in-yabi-subculture/

title: battle_fever_j
body:
The 3rd [[Super Sentai]] series.

Noteworthy as the first series in the franchise to use a giant robot, in the form of [[Battle Fever Robo]], following the example of [[Spider-Man (toei)|]]'s [[Leopardon]]. The first Sentai show co-produced with [[Marvel]], following after their work on Spider-Man.

title: kagaku_sentai_dynaman
body:
The 7th [[Super Sentai]] series.

While predating [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]], the Dynamen would appear in the [[Kaizoku Sentai Gokaiger|Gokaiger]] adaptation [[Power Rangers Megaforce|Super Megaforce]] as the Battalion Rangers (Power Rangers Battalion). Beyond Power Rangers, Dynaman would receive a six-episode gag dub for USA Network's Night Flight.

title: melanina_(jerry_wang)
body: Original character belonging to [[JERRY WANG]].

title: taiyou_sentai_sun_vulcan
body:
The 5th [[Super Sentai]] series.

The final [[Marvel]] co-production, ending the partnership that started with the 1978 [[Spider-Man (toei)|]] adapation. The earliest Sentai show to receive a pitch for an American adaptation, manifesting as a "dubbed sizzle reel":[https://www.inverse.com/article/29187-power-rangers-movie-margaret-loesch-marvel-saban] that has "yet to become available to the public":[https://lostmediawiki.com/Taiyo_Sentai_Sun_Vulcan_(lost_Marvel_pilot;_1980s)]. Margaret Loesch, who had worked with Marvel for the pitch, would eventually help in the greenlighting of Saban's [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]] for Fox News.

title: peebo
body:
[[Choudenshi Bioman]] character. The robotic guardian of the Biomen.

[[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]]'s [[Alpha 5]] would be inspired by Peebo, and the character would've borne that name had Saban managed to start Power Rangers with Bioman.

title: hypnotic_convenience_store_(mankai_kaika)
body:
Original series by [[Mankai Kaika]] that started in August 2024. 

It follows the middle-aged shut-in Harami Kouta who, after the death of his father, is entrusted with their familyâ€™s convenience store. However, his poor social skills, shabby appearance and lack of confidence draw the ire of those around him, especially his coworker and boss.

One day, while mulling over his lot in life, Haramiâ€™s work tablet mysteriously changes and grants him the power to hypnotize people. With his newfound powers, he begins a series of lewd escapades with seven women of different backgrounds and occupations.

The series typically updates twice a month.

title: civvie_11
body:
Youtuber who reviews and plays (mostly) boomer shooters and sometimes non-boomer shooters. Currently incarcerated in a facility run by the so-called 'Department of Special Corrections', where he gets tortured frequently by H4MMER and AX3 while making videos there. His videos are edited by CV-16, also known as Katie, who [spoiler]isn't real, it's actually just Civvie[/spoiler].

h4. External links

* "Youtube channel":https://www.youtube.com/@Civvie11

title: shokuhou_misaki_(desired_swimsuit)

title: hakui_koyori_(summer)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Hakui Koyori]], revealed on July 15, 2023. It comes in 2 versions: a swimsuit version and a sleepwear version.

* The swimsuit version consists of a [[frilled_choker|frilled]] [[white choker]] a, [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white jacket|white]] [[hooded jacket]]  with a [[wolf hood|coyote themed hood]] and [[cross-laced cutout]]s on the sleeves and, coyote-themed pockets (with a [i]Kewpie[/i] mayo bottle) and [[pom pom (clothes)|pom pom]] [[drawstring]]s, [[bikini under clothes|worn over]] a [[frilled bikini|frilled]] [[white bikini]] with a [[multi-strapped bikini top|multi-strapped]] [[front-tie bikini top|front-tie top]], an [[arm garter]] and a [[frilled thigh strap]], white [[leg ribbon]]s and [[white sandals|white]] [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[platform footwear]] sandals pink [[footwear bow|bows]].

* The loungewear version replaces the bikini with a [[frilled nightgown|frilled]] [[white nightgown]] with a coyote-shaped [[cleavage cutout]], [[empire waist]] and a [[front slit]] and [[white bloomers]].

She can also equip the [[lab coat]] from her [[hakui koyori (1st costume)|default costume]] with this costume.

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:
* [[Short hair]] tied in [[twin braids|twin]] [[side braids]] held together with a test tube [[hairclip]]s
* [[very long hair|Very long]] [[messy hair|messy]] [[wavy hair]] tied into [[low twintails]] with [[double-parted bangs|double-parted]] [[braided bangs]] held with a [[pink scrunchie|pink]] [[hair scrunchie]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #6495604: Profile
* !post #7854115: Merchandise

title: after_anilingus
body:
The aftermath of [[anilingus]]. 

Although easily confused for [[imminent anilingus]], telltale signs include [[saliva]] on the anus, a [[lipstick mark on anus|lipstick mark on the anus]], or [[stray pubic hair]] on the face of whoever performed the anilingus.

h4. Examples

title: idolmaster_one_for_all
body:
An entry in [[idolmaster|THE iDOLM@STER]] series, released for the [[Playstation 3]] in 2014. It features [[Leon (idolmaster)|]] as a new rival character.

h4. Costumes

title: raised_inner_eyebrows
body:
Eyebrows with only the inner ends raised, forming a kind of peak shape. Often an expression of [[smug]]ness or [[fear]].

h4. Examples

* !post #1727858
* !post #5726330
* !post #3914603
* !post #6295088

h4. See also

* [[v-shaped eyebrows]]

title: v-shaped_eyebrows
body:
Eyebrows that are slanted inwards, forming a V shape. Often used to indicate a sense of mischievousness or [[smug|smugness]], or alternatively [[angry|anger]] or [[annoyed|annoyance]].

[[V-shaped eyebrows]] is usually used in combination with emoticon tags:

* >:3 is {{:3 v-shaped_eyebrows}}
* >:D is {{:D v-shaped_eyebrows}}
* >:o is {{:o v-shaped_eyebrows}}
* etc.

h4. Examples

* !post #454825
* !post #1602747
* !post #1871573
* !post #2664329

h4. See also

* [[>:)]]
* [[>:(]]
* [[furrowed brow]]
* [[raised inner eyebrows]]
* [[Tag group:Face tags]]
